boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): War Zone Nachmund – Vigilus Alone
boardgame.description:
The worlds of the Vigilus System have echoed to the clamour of cataclysmic war for decades, assailed not only by xenos, but also the armies of Abaddon the Despoiler. A fragile survival was bought at terrible cost – now Vigilus itself must stand or fall without its most heroic saviour.

The planet is besieged, its neighbouring systems imperilled with the Great Rift closing in. If it cannot stand, then this beleaguered bastion world and all its defenders will be damned for eternity.

You will need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 Core Book to use the contents of this supplement.

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): War Zone Octarius – Book 1 – Rising Tide
boardgame.description:
In the Octarius Sector, the Imperium's worst fears have been realised. For years, the Tyranids of Hive Fleet Leviathan have been locked in a war of attrition with the Orks. Now, the conflict has spilt out into surrounding space, and the xenos forces descend on Imperial planets, hungry for battle and biomatter.

The combined forces of the Deathwatch, numerous Space Marine Chapters, and the legions of the Adeptus Mechanicus rush to stem the tide of destruction that threatens to engulf the Pankallis Sub-sector in war. Not all hope is lost: Inquisitor Athocles Van Roth is brewing a plan – a high stakes endeavour that may result in the total defeat of the Tyranid forces. The Imperium must be ready to do whatever it takes to stop the Octarius Sector from falling to ruin.

You will need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 Core Book to use the contents of this supplement.

boardgame.name: Dice Mancala: Expansion
ダイスマンカラ：拡張 (Dice_Mancala: Expansion)
boardgame.description:
ダイスマンカラ：拡張 (Dice_Mancala: Expansion) is an expansion to a dice game from Japan. The expansion has two extra variants for the base game. These can be combined.

The expansion 旬の宝石 (Seasonal Jewels) is a module that gets additional points in the set collection as you collect the same colors. With simple rules, it is recommended to used as soon as you learn the base game.

The expansion 悩みの種 (Troublesome) adds an additional dice to get in the way when you're in the mancala phase. Players with this will lose their turn privilege and will roll the dice from the beginning. At the end of the turn, place the Troublesome dice on the board again. Make good use of it and increase the number of times you roll the dice.
publisher's summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Ferret Games Factory (フェレットゲームズファクトリー)

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): War Zone Octarius – Book 2 – Critical Mass
boardgame.description:
Hive Fleet Leviathan bears down on the Octarius sector's heart, while the critical forge world of Sigma-Ulstari fights for its life against repeated xenos invasions. As battles become desperate and the fate of billions hangs in the balance, forces on all sides marshal their deadliest weapons in preparation for the Octarian War's apocalyptic conclusion.

From the ashes of Octarius a victor will emerge, tempered in the bloodiest conflict seen in millennia, but who will it be? The Tyranids pit their finest strategic mind, the Swarmlord, against the uncompromising brutality of the Overfiend of Octarius, all while Imperial systems battle to contain the overflowing carnage.

You will need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 Core Book to use the contents of this book.

boardgame.name: Bonnie and Clyde, Love and Death
boardgame.description:
Bonnie & Clyde, Love and Death is first and foremost a solo game that can also be played as a duo, where the goal is to find the romantic end that the couple dreamed of.

Along this road trip, you will have to choose the right actions to survive, stick up banks or stores, but also keep an eye on the gas tank and the state of your vehicle, and, of course, outrun the cops, who will only get better and better at tracking you down.

At the beginning of the game, you choose from four levels of difficulty and set out on the first country road.

Each turn represents a day divided into three phases: Morning, Afternoon, and Night.

During the game, you have to manage your resource and situation gauges. Some of them can lead to your death, such as not having any food or ammunition during a shootout; others can lead to defeat, such as having a love gauge at zero, which would lead to the separation of the couple. It is therefore important to fulfill the victory conditions before triggering any defeat condition.

In easy mode, the goal is to finish your run with a shoutout in a farmhouse, with two bank loot and your love gauge raised to the maximum before the police — or someone — kill Bonnie or Clyde.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Chapter Approved – War Zone Nachmund Grand Tournament Mission Pack and Munitorum Field Manual 2022
boardgame.description:
This edition of Chapter Approved is the essential gaming toolbox for all fans of Warhammer 40,000 matched play. Whether you're a tournament regular or simply like to ensure your battles are always fought on an even footing, this is the essential supplement for matched play games of Warhammer 40,000. Inside this 56-page softback book, you'll find:

- Two mission packs, comprising nine missions each for Incursion and Strike Force battles, each designed to offer a different challenge to the players.

- Guidelines for setting up and playing a matched play or Grand Tournament-level competitive game, including suggested battlefield size, time limit and how best to determine secondary objectives.

- 23 secondary objectives. Some are entirely new, while others have been tweaked, or had the amount of victory points they award adjusted.

- And much, much more…

In addition, you'll also find a separate 56-page book – the Munitorum Field Manual 2022 – containing all the latest matched play points updates, painstakingly balanced and tuned in conjunction with major tournament organisers and our playtesters.

You will need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 Core Book to use the contents of this supplement.

boardgame.name: Dream Team: Partner oder Gegenspieler?
boardgame.description:
Dream Team is a quiz game in which the 2 teams are formed every turn in a new way. In this way, every player can benefit from the strengths of the other players in his team and tries to use his knowledge the best possible way by persuading the other players.

The goal of the game is to get the most victory points during the game and be the first one on the stellar target field.

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Crusade Mission Pack – Wars of Faith
boardgame.description:
This mission pack is a narrative play expansion for the Warhammer 40,000 Crusade campaign system.

Within this book, you’ll find the rules required to play games of Warhammer 40,000 set in the Nachmund Gauntlet, which continues to suffer under the assault of Chaos and xenos forces.

This mission pack has been specifically designed for use in narrative play Crusade games, where your campaigning forces can battle across the war-torn world of Vigilus and beyond. With Marneus Calgar seemingly slain by Abaddon the Despoiler, and the planet’s surface overrun by aliens and Heretic Astartes, will your Crusade force emerge as heroes in this time of need or be crushed beneath the boots of their enemies?

This 120-page mission pack includes:

- Six missions each for Combat Patrol-, Incursion-, Strike Force- and Onslaught-sized games, all set within the beleaguered Nachmund Gauntlet
- Wars of Faith mechanics that allow armies to earn Belief Points to purchase additional abilities
- Priests Battle Traits to be used in Wars of Faith, plus Requisitions and Agendas
- The basic rules for Warhammer 40,000 – designed to be quickly referenced during your games

The pack itself is presented in a full Canadian wiro ring-bound book for easy use on the tabletop during games, and it comes with an elastic closure. You will need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 Core Book to use the contents of this mission pack.

boardgame.name: ToeJam & Earl Tabletop Remix
boardgame.description:
Celebrate 30 years of funk! ToeJam and Earl take it to the tabletop in this brand-new Rogue like Party Board Game, where players can experience new and different levels every session!

Be the first player to find and collect 3 Rocketship pieces - while not letting the Earthlings trip you up! Players roll dice and move along the track collecting rocket ship pieces and presents. Every present is different and may just give you the winning edge!

ToeJam & Earl Tabletop Remix is fully compatible with Yooka-Laylee and Mutant Mudds Game Decks board games! Mix and match for some truly funky results!

boardgame.name: Wabbeln
boardgame.description: Every player tries to throw his coins as near as possible to the wall. The one whose coin is the nearest wins.

boardgame.name: TropeQuest
boardgame.description:
TropeQuest pokes fun at everyone's favorite sci-fi and fantasy stereotypes and puts them literally into the hands of the players, who attempt to turn a pile of genre fiction cliches into a workable narrative. It's a creative, collaborative game with a lighthearted competitive element that uses cards and a board to make it fun and easy for players to improvise an original story. Best of all, it generates a unique tale each and every time it's played.

The board provides the story arc, a plot map that packs as many cliched scenarios and overwrought plot twists as possible into fifteen squares. The deck brings the setting... a library of genre tropes and oblique pop culture references to tickle the imaginations of geeks and laypersons alike. Players and encouraged to mix, match, and try out new combinations.

After a deck of tropes and a plot board are chosen, players are each dealt a hand of cards and take turns being the Narrator. The Narrator reads the prompt on the next available square and chooses a card from a pool of trope cards submitted by adjacent players (plus one random from the deck) to finish the prompt. While this may yield some hilarious results, the Narrator's work has not yet begun! Next, the Narrator "sells" the scene by elaborating, tying up loose ends, spicing it up a bit. Afterwards, the players redraw cards, the player whose card was picked draws an extra one, and the next player becomes the Narrator. Rinse and repeat until all fifteen squares have been played and the story has reached its thrilling climax.

So, the story is over. What was the point of it all? Well, in a way, the goal of the game is to laugh, have fun, and tell a quirky story together. However, in another, more mathematical and literal way, the goal of the game is to win by having more cards than anyone else at the end of the game. But winning also comes with great responsibility! After the gloating is over, the winner then chooses their favorite scene in the story Narrated by another player. That player then becomes the Chosen One, Master of Tropes and The Uber-Winner of that round of TropeQuest.

boardgame.name: Chronicles of Drunagor: Age of Darkness Backer's Campaign
boardgame.description:
A box containing the various stretch goals from the Gamefound campaign, containing:

32 miniatures
194 cards
2 organizing trays
9 new adventures
5 new dungeon roles
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Chronicles of Drunagor: Age of Darkness

boardgame.name: Two Some
Twosome
boardgame.description:
In Two Some, you and another player answer the ultimate "me or you" questions to see how well you know each other, either playing with just the two of you or going head-to-head against up to three other couples.

Each round, two cards are revealed to the group, such as "avoid when hungry" and "better poker face", or perhaps "laughs at own jokes" and "knows more types of plants". Each player simultaneously chooses which of the two cards they feel they are better at than their partner. If both players on the same team choose different cards, they are on the same wavelength and score. The team with the highest score after twelve rounds wins.

Break the ice and find out whether you are the perfect pair or perfect strangers!

boardgame.name: Rising Waters
boardgame.description: Rising Waters draws players into the world of the Mississippi Delta during the catastrophic 1927 flood. Players assume roles of members of the African American community, working cooperatively through area control and set collection mechanics to stay alive and avoid losses of people, towns, and land for the 14 weeks of the flood.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Center for Learning Through Games and Simulations

boardgame.name: La mansión de Drácula
boardgame.description:
La mansión de Drácula ("Dracula's Manor") is solitaire card game where you enter Dracula's lair to find your kidnapped relatives, as long as you also try to kill the King of Vampire before it's midnight.

In every turn, the player reveals a card until he finds a room card. An Event or Relative card can also be drawn, in which case it will be activated in the next room. The player has a limited time to find among the cards their relatives. The goal of the game is to find them and/or kill Dracula before he awakes. The game ends if the player leaves the Manor, rescue their relatives or kill Dracula (win), or is killed by Dracula's minions or Dracula himself.

This fast paced card game is inspired in the modern solitaire RPG's questzines but its roots are in the 80's videogames.

boardgame.name: Within Walls
boardgame.description:
Within Walls is a Paranoia driven hidden traitor game with social deduction elements set in the early 20th century horror setting. The gameplay is heavily focused on player interaction with intuitive rules that are designed merely as a catalyst for player interaction and serve the purpose to define available options.
You are agents sent to investigate an incident in a local sanatorium. Upon arrival on the scene you realize there is an impostor among you.
Your goal is to gather as much information as possible while making sure all witnesses remain alive for further questioning.

Move through the Story by drawing Event cards and playing them during your turn in accordance with your agenda, the mandatory play means you will be faced with several bad choices - in this game most choices are bad. As the story advances more and more clues are found about the traitor, however reaching the end of any story Act with the traitor alive means that the agents lose the game. The traitor(s) must be stopped before reaching the completion of his mission. A unique story progress board is used to mark the progress of the team as a whole while individual Mind sheets follow players' descent into inevitable madness.
The game ends either when the Agents win by discovering and eliminating the Traitor or when the Traitor wins by either eliminating all Agents or reaching the end of the story and completing his goal.
The special 2 player game mode keeps the suspense, social deduction elements and paranoia with only minor rule changes.
Included is one Investigation focus die made of wood, as imperfect as the world you are playing in and unique,, again.. as this world.

boardgame.name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Helmeted S.P.D. Shadow Ranger Promo
boardgame.description:
Anubis Cruger typically leads the S.P.D. Rangers from afar, but when needed he can join the fight as the Shadow Ranger, wielding his Shadow Saber.

Includes an alternate mini depicting the S.P.D. Shadow Ranger wearing a helmet.

This accessory requires Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid and the Ranger Allies Pack #1 expansion to play!
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid
Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Ranger Allies Pack #1

boardgame.name: Keep a Straight Face
boardgame.description:
Act, sing, and dance your way through these cringe-worthy and laughter-worthy cards. Suitable for little ones and big ones this card game is fun for the whole family! Be warned as the crack of a smile can mean losing the game.

A player spins the spinner to select another player to try to make laugh. That person then draws a card and performs the silly action printed on it, hoping to make one or more players at the table break their stoicism. If the targeted player laughs, the active player collects the card.

Collect 10 cards and you win!

boardgame.name: Big Ten Game Day
boardgame.description:
The player on offense and the player on defense each plays a card face down. Both players then flip their cards over at the same time revealing the selected plays. Once a card is played, it is discarded in a separate pile which becomes the discard pile. After each play advance the down counter to the next down unless there is a first down conversion, a scoring play, or a turnover.

The game is played in two “halves”. A half is over when there are no more cards available and neither player has a card in his hand. A half will take from 30 to 45 minutes. When the half is over, shuffle all the Offense, Defense, and Special Teams decks. Each player draws 5 cards to start the second half.

The Game is over at the end of the second half. The player with the most points wins. For a shorter game, play 1 half.

boardgame.name: Advanced Tobruk 2016: Electric Whiskers – Expansion 1
boardgame.description: First expansion for the 2016 big-hex reissue of the classic Advanced Tobruk wargame, including two pages of additional rules (Battlefield Walkaround), eight scenarios from June to December 1940, some additional Italian and British vehicle counters (ATS North Africa Expansion AFVs 2016_1940), a couple of pages of terrain overlays (wire, encampment and depots) and another two pages of vehicle cards.

boardgame.name: A Moveable Feast
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb

In Quick Quest 2: A Moveable Feast, your party is investigating an orcish outpost and encounters two very unusual pets . . .

Quick Quests are super-short adventures for The Fantasy Trip. Each one is about 2,500 words of character description, GM advice, and combat. Definitely combat.

You can use a Quick Quest in several ways:

As a stand-alone adventure for a night or two of play.
As a side quest to drop into an ongoing campaign.
As a seed for a whole new campaign.

boardgame.name: The Unself King
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb

In Quick Quest 3: The Unself King – The Charnel Maiden, the Mother of Despair, and the Drear Crone are all figures of horror. Now they are together, working to unleash something far worse.

Quick Quests are super-short adventures for The Fantasy Trip. Each one is about 2,500 words of character description, GM advice, and combat. Definitely combat.

You can use a Quick Quest in several ways:

As a stand-alone adventure for a night or two of play.
As a side quest to drop into an ongoing campaign.
As a seed for a whole new campaign.

boardgame.name: The Caravan Raiders
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb

Quick Quest 4: The Caravan Raiders is a short but action-packed adventure with blazing wagons, piles of bodies, a ghost to face, and a puzzle to solve – all in 2,500 words!

Quick Quests are super-short adventures for The Fantasy Trip. Each one is about 2,500 words of character description, GM advice, and combat. Definitely combat.

You can use a Quick Quest in several ways:

As a stand-alone adventure for a night or two of play.
As a side quest to drop into an ongoing campaign.
As a seed for a whole new campaign.

boardgame.name: Likes
boardgame.description:
A party game where you and your friends will create fake online dating profiles.

Each round, one of the players is the judge and chooses a profile picture from the deck. Each other player then selects a card from their hand to create a memorable, intriguing, or hilarious dating profile.

The judge chooses their favorite and rewards the creator of the profile with a "Like".
At the end of the game, players choose the "best" profile and use their "Likes" to vote on which player is most likely to date them. Whether that makes you the "winner" depends on the profile you decided was best.

boardgame.name: Fatum Dark Myths
boardgame.description:
From the Back of the Box

Quick and Random Character Story Creation!

FATUM is a powerful yet easy tool designed to create full-fledged stories for your RPG characters. Although built with modern/terror roleplaying game systems in mind. It's been developed to fuel other artistic creations, whether you are a writer, a screenwriter, or an illustrator.

boardgame.name: Steampunk Expansion
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb

Industry and science advance unstoppable. Cities grow between chimneys steam and secret basement experiments.

This include an expansion pack of 15 cards for your FATUM deck.

Expansion pack card list is the following:

Gunslinger / Sharpshooter (BG)
Inventor / Devout (BG)
Mechanic / Scrap dealer (BG)
Alchemist / Archaeologist (BG)
Magnate / Politician (BG)
Gambler / Gravedigger (BG)
Hybrid (R)
Experiment (R)
Clockwork familiar (Bo)
Clockwork golem (Bo)
Time travel (E)
Mechanic Prosthetic Limb (E)
Submarine / Airship (P)
Train / Carriage (P)
Wokshop / Time Machine (P)

boardgame.name: Sci-Fi Expansion
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb

Space missions full of dangers and new forms of life. The stars they hide a multitude of secrets ready to be discovered.

This includes an expansion pack of 15 cards for your FATUM deck.
Expansion pack card list is the following:

Bountyhunter / Fugitive (BG)
Enginner / IT Specialist (BG)
Pilot / Crewmember (BG)
Pathfinder / Conqueror (BG)
Space entity (BG)
Cyborg (R)
Alien (R)
Tech enhanced (R)
Genetically enhanced (R)
Exploration mission / Unauthorized mission (E)
Pleasure Trip / Business Trip (E)
Spaceship / Escape Pod (P)
Terraformed Planet / Hazardous Planet (P)
Exoplanet / Planet (P)
Far galaxy / Current galaxy (P)

boardgame.name: Gothic Punk Expansion
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb

Vampires, werewolves and other supernatural rule the night. Create characters for your games of urban gothic narrative full of mystery and magic.

This include an expansion pack of 14 cards for your FATUM deck.

Expansion pack card list is the following:

Modern Mage (BG)
Hunter (BG)
Ancient Vampire / Young Vampire (R)
Elder Werewolf / Rookie Werewolf (R)
Social Vampire / Warrior Vampire (R)
Urbanite Werewolf / Wild Werewolf (R)
Spirit / Zombie (R)
Confidant / Slave (Bo)
Hunt / Slaughter (E)
Frenzy / Seeking redemption (E)
Sacred place / Cursed place (P)
Hideout / Haven (P)
Night Club / Library (P)
Friendly territory / Enemy Territory (P)

boardgame.name: Epic Paths Expansion
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb

Fill your games with epicity, because heroes are forged in adversity.

This include an expansion pack of 10 cards for your FATUM deck.

Expansion pack card list is the following:

Avatar (BG)
Forgotten God (BG)
Bodyguard / Protégé (Bo)
Stepmother / Stepfather (Bo)
Bastard / Twins (Bo)
Familiar (Bo)
Animal Companion (Bo)
Sacred Mision / Destruction (E)
End of times / Pandemic (E)
Other Dimension / Portal between worlds (P)

boardgame.name: Mythological Races Expansion
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb

This include an expansion pack for your FATUM deck.

Expansion pack card list is the following:


Undead
Shapeshifter
Centaur
Anthromorphic Animal
Elemental
Giant
Fey
Forged

boardgame.name: Character's Notebook
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb

Hardcover with gold foil stamping. Size: 167 x 122mm 176 color printed pages.

User Summary

This book is divided into two sections. Two-thirds of the book is devoted to character creation and features spaces to record the layout of cards, essential details, equipment and bio.

The remaining third is for Storyline creation and features the storyline layout plus pages for a summary.

boardgame.name: Merry Dissmas
boardgame.description: A rotating Diss-Master reads a card out loud to the group (for example: Who's the worst gift-giver? The chronic over-sharer? The pickiest eater?). Everyone else writes down their answer on their dry-erase boards, and then it's up to the Diss-Master to pick their favorite answer— after reading all the responses out loud, of course!

boardgame.name: Feywild Robbery
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Journey to Barrenland, a Domain of Delight inspired by folk songs (Forró)

An inhospitable land where towering cacti forest provides shelter from the scorching sun. Stubborn albeit altruistic fey gather in small communities to survive the arid and rugged terrain.

Rob a caravan

Every year, a fey caravan uses two fey crossings to get to their destination. This caravan is full of water barrels and the goblin outlaws take great pride in stealing from their fey brethren.

Their skeleton-crew needs extra hands so they call pull this feywild robbery! Only brave adventurers can assist the goblin outlaws in their quest to "rob" the caravan before it reaches the fey crossing.

Fight a powerful fey

A trio of evil fey plan to dethrone the ruling Archfeys. One of them plans to kill passengers in the caravan and blame the goblins, which will cause turmoil between the seelie and unseelie courts!

Only you may be able to stop them!
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Trial of Flower
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A special cure requires a special ingredient. A flower deep within the forest of Ayten is one such ingredient. Located deep within the Monster Timberland, home to gargantuan trees and huge monstrosity can the heroes survive the Trial of Flower?
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Goblin Ref - Monsters of Amoverek
boardgame.description: From goblin kings to mischievous goblin thiefs to helpful goblin guides, goblins bring the unexpected into fantasy, romance, and mythological fantasy stories.

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Orc Ref - Monsters of Amoverek
boardgame.description: From orc grunts to orce hordes to orc kings, orcs bring aggression into fantasy, romance, and mythological fantasy stories.

boardgame.name: La Casa de Papel: Behind the mask
boardgame.description:
The Netflix TV series that captivated millions of viewers has just become an exciting board game so you can experience the emotions and vicissitudes of the most famous band of thieves of all time.
The game contains: a layout board of the Spanish Mint, 5 screens for hiding your notes from opponents, 1 pad of sheets for jotting down clues, 5 hostage pawns and 8 robber tiles.
With the 44 cards in the game, the players/detectives must discover the identities of the 8 robbers, jotting down the Clues, Confidential Information and Characteristics emerging during the game.
A deduction game in which you must work to reveal the identities of the thieves just like real detectives!
A game that never ceases to amaze match after match, engaging everyone, not only fans of the series, in a fascinating, in-depth and first-hand investigation through a unique recreational experience.

Each turn the professor will call the police and you can reach a different room in the Mint. Here you can check a number of clue depending on the turn you are playing but the thief will be stressed by you and if they go "out of control" they will modify the quantity of the symbols in the room.

To deduct the identity of the wight thieves you'll need to understand which of the three symbols is the most present in each room.

boardgame.name: Farthest Star
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Farthest Star: Sci-Fi Skirmish Role-Play For One Or More Players lets you build a crew of space faring adventurers bent on seeking their varied goals under the spectral light of alien suns! Whether you plan to do a little bit of good, a little bit of bad, or a little bit of both, this set of Goalsystem RPG skirmish rules will let you tell compelling tabletop stories.

Designed for use with any 28mm or 15mm figures in your collection, Farthest Star offers detailed character creation and campaign rules in any of four play modes: PvP skirmish, solo, cooperative, or collaborative RPG. Build a unique crew of characters and watch them change and grow as they survive desperate battles on the galactic fringes!

User summary:

The roleplaying aspects of the game are presented in an optional, modular segment of the rules.

boardgame.name: The Awfully Cheerful Engine!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Action! Adventure! Fun!

Welcome to the Awfully Cheerful Engine, a cinematic tabletop roleplaying game of comedic action.

Play as a Hero and save the world! Talking animals and aliens, vampires and elves, cowboys and spacemen - the worlds of action cinema and cartoon mayhem are yours! From fantasy realms to galaxies in the far-flung future, the streets of Manhattan to the depths of Transylvania, the whole universe is your sandbox!

boardgame.name: The Spirits of Manhattan
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

There’s Something Strange Going On...

Strap on your Anti-Plasm Particle Thrower, grab your Electromagnetic Field Detector, and jump into your Ghostmobile. New York City needs your help! Battle ghostly creeps, phantasmal drakes, shriekers, slime buckets, and terror dogs!

Play as a ghost, or take up a career as a demonologist or exorcist! Learn the skills of parapsychology, cryptozoology, and parazoology! And try not to do too much collateral damage...

boardgame.name: Montana Drones and the Raiders of the Cutty Sark
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Return of the Great Adventure!

Settle your fedora, grab your knapsack and snap your bullwhip into action. The allies need your help to protect one of history’s strangest relics!

This action-packed adventure will take you around the globe as you battle nefarious relic hunters, otherworldly entities, diabolic witches, and even the Nazi war machine. You can choose one of the four pregenerated characters made specifically for this adventure, or whip up a character in no time using the ACE! rules and try out one of four new occupations, including the Botanist, Double- Agent, Socialite, and Witch.

Learn about snippets of history as you track down the corselet of Mégês, stroll the corridors of Halcyon Hall, and race against time to recover the famous Cutty Sark—the shirt mentioned in Tam o’ Shanter rumoured to possess magical powers. You’ll also have the chance to explore the ancient ruins of Petra, hobnob with lords and ladies at the U.S. Embassy in London, and sprint across Great Britain to Ayr in pursuit of the notorious stole.

This fast, fun, and tongue-in-cheek adventure for the ACE! roleplaying system includes all the material you need to run your own relic hunting escapade.

boardgame.name: Strange Science
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to Wilden Falls.

Your average American town in the heart of the country.

Until weird things start happening at the local research facility, people go missing, and there’s a sudden influx of fitness nuts in the town. That’s before we get to the time travel, bodysnatching, and portals to other dimensions. Maybe ‘strange’ isn’t strong enough a word for it!

boardgame.name: Beam Me Up
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

We come in peace (shoot to kill)

These are the voyages of the starship FSS Brazen. Its continuing mission: to recklessly go where plenty of people have probably been before… and hope a major interstellar incident isn’t sparked in the process. In this highly illogical adventure for the ACE! roleplaying game, you’ll explore frontiers you never thought you had.

boardgame.name: Orcs & Oubliettes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dungeons meet dragons!

Don your armour, sharpen your sword and ready your lantern. The residents of the city of Heq Moreveg are in danger and only you have the mettle needed to save them!

This action-packed adventure will take you through dungeons, sewers, and city streets as you investigate kidnappings, clash with a nefarious cult, rescue some orcs, and even battle a might dragon! You can choose one of the four pregenerated characters made specifically for this adventure or summon up a character in no time using the ACE! rules and try out one of four new occupations, including the Captain of the Watch, Sprite, and Troll.

As members of the city’s Dusk Watch, you will have the chance to stroll its vibrant streets and meet its eclectic communities. You’ll also have the opportunity to rub shoulders with nobility and check your pockets after visiting the thieves’ guilds. It isn’t long before the city is placed in perilous danger, however, and you’ll need to call on every trick in the watch’s rulebook to survive the trials of orcs and oubliettes!

This fast, fun, tongue-in-cheek adventure for the ACE! roleplaying system includes all the material you need to run your own dungeon-delving and dragon-slaying caper.

boardgame.name: Awfully Cheerful Extras Deck
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This deck contains a card for each of the monsters and NPCs (non-player characters, which we call 'Extras') found across all five books, color-coded based on the book they came from - 22 yellow cards from the core rules, 8 brown cards from Raiders of the Cutty Sark, 11 green cards from Spirits of Manhattan, 8 purple cards from Strange Science, and 6 blue cards (including 3 starships) from Beam Me Up.

boardgame.name: Awfully Cheerful ID Cards
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A deck of 40 blank A.C.E! ID cards, in four colors (10 each of green, blue, yellow, and black-and-white).

These are glossy cards. These cards can be written on permanently with a biro or ball-point pen, or non-permanently with wet or dry-erase markers. They can't be written on with a pencil.

For use with the Awfully Cheerful Engine!

boardgame.name: Awfully Cheerful Role Deck
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A deck for players, with each possible Role on a card. Robots, vampires, dogs, cats, ninjas, scientists, elves, trolls, aliens, ghosts, the whole works! There are dozens of Roles in this deck, from different genres, taken from all five books.

boardgame.name: Tabletops & Tentacles (Volume 1, Issue #3 - Sep 2021)
boardgame.description: With Tabletops & Tentacles, we aim to recreate the feel of a convention in an indie magazine, with content including comics, games, RPGs, film, books, and short fiction.

boardgame.name: 3DIE6 Core Rulebook Deluxe Edition
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

3DIE6 is a new game system, designed to be quick to learn, high on chaos and low on nit-picking. At its heart it is an old-school dungeon crawler with elements of funnel and OSR games. I wanted to create something that was easy to sit down for a one-shot or fill-in game and, because the life of an RPG designer is a lonely one, I also wanted it to be solo-able. For most checks, it's a simple stat check or a roll of the 3DIE6 dice. All you'll need to play is the Rulebook and three six-sided dice. (Ideally three different colors) A printout of the character sheet, a pen or pencil and a few markers like coins would be handy as well for keeping track of things.

The dice in 3DIE6 are used two different ways in the game. For stat checks it's a simple roll. Toss the 3D6, total them, add or subtract any modifiers and if you exceed the goal for that check, you succeed. For things like battle and special challenges, the lowly 3D6 become 3DIE6! When you roll for a 3DIE6 check, each represent a different thing - there's the Attack/Interact die, the Defense/Challenge die and the Effect die. For any check requiring a roll, you throw all three. After adding or subtracting any skills and modifiers your character has affecting it, the Attack and Defense dice tell you if you've succeeded in what you are attempting. Then the Effect die tells you how the enemy responds or what happens next!
...
This is the DELUXE Version of the Core Rules - It includes the basics for what you need to play a game of 3DIE6 as well as extra monsters, tables, adventure spores and two adventures.

boardgame.name: 3DIE6 Core Rulebook 'Zine Edition
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

3DIE6 is a new game system, designed to be quick to learn, high on chaos and low on nit-picking. At its heart it is an old-school dungeon crawler with elements of funnel and OSR games. I wanted to create something that was easy to sit down for a one-shot or fill-in game and, because the life of an RPG designer is a lonely one, I also wanted it to be solo-able. For most checks, it's a simple stat check or a roll of the 3DIE6 dice. All you'll need to play is the Rulebook and three six-sided dice. (Ideally three different colors) A printout of the character sheet, a pen or pencil and a few markers like coins would be handy as well for keeping track of things.

The dice in 3DIE6 are used two different ways in the game. For stat checks it's a simple roll. Toss the 3D6, total them, add or subtract any modifiers and if you exceed the goal for that check, you succeed. For things like battle and special challenges, the lowly 3D6 become 3DIE6! When you roll for a 3DIE6 check, each represent a different thing - there's the Attack/Interact die, the Defense/Challenge die and the Effect die. For any check requiring a roll, you throw all three. After adding or subtracting any skills and modifiers your character has affecting it, the Attack and Defense dice tell you if you've succeeded in what you are attempting. Then the Effect die tells you how the enemy responds or what happens next!
...
This is the Zinequest 3 'Zine Version of the Core Rules - It includes the basics for what you need to play a game of 3DIE6.

boardgame.name: The Egg Hunt
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is an adventure book for the 3DIE6 game system taking place in THE SHIMMER. A subterranean world of glowing mushrooms, strange creatures, winding tunnels, and death!

The Delve Your Own Dungeon books are “adventure gamebook” style quests where you make solo journeys into the depths of the world to answer questions, battle creatures, or succeed at quests. Along the way, you will face combat, skill checks, branching decisions, and likely a few deaths.
...
In the Egg Hunt, you are on a desperate chase against time to uncover the culprits that stole a clutch of eggs from your city and recover them before it is too late!

boardgame.name: The Lost City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is an adventure book for the 3DIE6 game system taking place in THE SHIMMER. A subterranean world of glowing mushrooms, strange creatures, winding tunnels, and death!

The Delve Your Own Dungeon books are “adventure gamebook” style quests where you make solo journeys into the depths of the world to answer questions, battle creatures, or succeed at quests. Along the way, you will face combat, skill checks, branching decisions, and likely a few deaths.
...
The Lost City will take your Roan Adventurer deep into the depths of the outer tunnels following rumors of a lost city of Roans. More of an exploration than The Egg Hunt, this new adventure will pit all of your skills against the elements to survive and uncover the secrets of The Lost City.

boardgame.name: The Egg Hunt / The Lost City Flipbook
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is an adventure book for the 3DIE6 game system taking place in THE SHIMMER. A subterranean world of glowing mushrooms, strange creatures, winding tunnels, and death!

The Delve Your Own Dungeon books are “adventure gamebook” style quests where you make solo journeys into the depths of the world to answer questions, battle creatures, or succeed at quests. Along the way, you will face combat, skill checks, branching decisions, and likely a few deaths.
...
This book features the first two Delve Your Own Adventure books in old-school flip book format!

User summary:

This item includes material published separately as:

The Egg Hunt
The Lost City

boardgame.name: Memoroute
메모루트
boardgame.description:
Memoroute is a memory game which moles compete to open new underground paths. Unlike other memory games, you don't take two matching tiles, instead, your mole moves to a hole next to the matching tile that you opened secondly. Most of the times, you have to match several tile sets (and move your mole) until your mole finally reaches to a hole you are to connect.

On your turn, you select one of the face-down flower tiles adjacent to your mole pawn and flip it to the flower side, and then select another face-down flower tile from anywhere on the board. If the two tiles match, move your mole next to one of the holes adjacent to the second tile.

You keep having your turn until you fail to find two matching tiles. And in anytime during your turn, if your mole gets to a hole indicated on your mission card, you flip that card and continue your turn.

When you fail, you reset the game board by flipping all the opened tile and pass your turn. When a player flips all four mission cards, the player wins!

Moles, moles! Find the holes and stick the poles!

boardgame.name: The Malinsay Massacre
boardgame.description:
Crime Dossier 3 of a 4 book set that was an early progenitor of the modern mystery suspect / cold case tabletop games.

The Earl of Malinsay is dead, and ruin comes to an ancient family. Did the valet really murder his master, or did the mysterious foreigner send poisoned sweets to Viscount Raeburn? Whose handwriting is on the label and who put arsenic in the peppermints? Is the beautiful Countess conspiring with her lover or is the secret of the Malinsays hidden in the past?

boardgame.name: My Brand
boardgame.description:
The personal branding game, MY BRAND, is developed based on the 5-personality type of 'CEO Brand Big 5'. This theory is based on the "Brand Personality Big 5", developed by Professor Jennifer Aaker of Standford University.

Players become brand managers, and through three consecutive games that they will play, they will help others and themselves to learn about their current brands and the brands that they are to persue.

Game 1
Each player is dealt with 8 brand cards.
Pick a card from the hand and introduce themselves using the brand card.
Players vote two players who presented the best.
Take the card and make your personal 'Brand Archive' pile.

Game 2
Each player is dealt with 8 brand cards.
Pick two card from the hand and open them on the table.
Then players tell stories about the strengths they have.
The other players offer each narrator a card from their hands.
The narrator takes two cards among them.
Send those two cards along with two other cards you previously places on the table to your 'Brand Archive'.

Game 3
Each player is dealt with 8 brand cards.
Players take turn become a presenter. The presenter opens a Question card.
Question cards have questions like:
'What is the cover of your autobiography that you've published 20 years later like?'
'What is the feed you are uploading, 5 years later, as a social media influencer like?
All players place a card face-down. The presenter gather the cards from the other players and add more card from the deck to make a total of 7 Brand cards. Shuffle them and open those cards in a single line.
Players secretly select two cards they think most accurately represent the presenter related to the question.
Then place tokens on those two cards. If more than two players selected the same cards, those players each gain points as many as the number of tokens on it.
Sent three cards which have the most vote along with your own card to your 'Brand Archive.'

Players gain points as they play each game, they get points from the vote they get and the cards selected by other players, etc. Whoever has the highest score after three games becomes the best brand manager and wins the game.

After the game, you can examine and draw your brand in graph at the back of your sheet.
It will visually tell you your current brand and the brand to pursue.

boardgame.name: Forests of Pangaia: Laserox Wooden Insert
boardgame.description: Wooden insert designed by Laserox and provided as an add-on during the kickstarter campaign

boardgame.name: Sea Battle Agrisha
boardgame.description:
Sea Battle Agrisha is a 2-player drafting and worker placement game using similar mechanics as Agrisha. Players draw resource dice from a bag, roll them, draft them, and then take actions, such as placing or removing Sway, to secure control of the ships involved in the fight.

Unlike Agrisha, the players in Sea Battle Agrisha have asymmetrical starting positions. Both players have a Captain and First Mate who have unique special abilities. Additionally, both players control a flagship, which are also not identical.

There are 2 pages to print, and you will need a number of dice and tokens (beads, cubes, or whatnot) to play.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Wild West Exodus: Showdown at Retribution
boardgame.description:
Wild West Exodus is a dynamic, fast-paced tabletop miniatures game pitting a cast of heroic characters against each other in a brutal world - very much a twisted reflection of our own. In the twilight years of the Nineteenth Century, mankind is perched upon a new age of discovery and enlightenment.

However, humanity’s greed and ambition have created a Dystopian Age where nations clash and the threat of war forever lingers. We must remember that all is not lost. In Wild West Exodus the bravery and actions of individuals on the frontier can still forge legends and change the world.

Showdown at Retribution is a two-player starter set designed to give you a comprehensive introduction to the savage Wild West in the Dystopian Age. Containing dozens of fantastically detailed Warcradle miniatures, the full third edition rulebook, quick start guide to help you get going straight away and much more - this hefty boxed set is an easy way to explore the game and start your hobby adventure.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2022 UK Games Expo Best Miniatures Rules Nominee
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Wild West Exodus: Gunfight at Red Oak

boardgame.name: Skilled: Das Bike Spiel
boardgame.description:
A game to experience the world of cycling and to explore the cycling world of Austria.
A combination of tactics and concentration as well as muscle power provides the necessary variety to win the game and to become the best biker who feels just as comfortable on trails as on racing bike courses.

The aim of the game is to “cycle” 500 points on the points table.
The biker (player) who does this first is declared the winner.
The last biker to reach the finish invites the winner to a bike ride. :-)
The points can be collected on the bike routes on the game board in the individual bike regions of austria, when passing the starting fields and through clever tactics with the playing cards.

boardgame.name: Dice Cup
boardgame.description:
GAME IDEA
The game is played in 12 rounds in which the dice fall anew each time. All see the same result but everybody from another perspective. Each player always tries to find the best scoring category for him.
But attention:
Each category is available only once per game! So far so easy, if only the dice would not always disappear under the cup again so fast … Who has grasped the best result in the short term? And in which category would eventually have been more to achieve?

GOAL OF THE GAME
The player with the highest total score in the end wins the DICE CUP-Challenge!

PREPARATION
Put the dice in the cup. Each player gets a scoring sheet and a pen – and writes down his name on the up right line intended for it. Now a starting player is chosen and off we go!

GAME PLAY
The starting player starts rolling the dice but still everybody plays always simultaneously.
Each round consists of 8 steps:

Put all dice in the cup.
Your hand above it and shake it well.
Turn around the cup with the dice and overthrow it on the table so all dice are hidden underneath the cup.
Lift up the cup for about 3 seconds (to measure the time, slowly say the following slogan: „Lift the cup – eyes up“). The dice must be clearly visible for everybody for the same amount of time.
Then the cup is put over the dice again carefully so that they are not turned over accidentally.
Now each player sets a cross in the little circle of the box in the category he wants to value. You can use your hand as a sight screen. Once the cross is set it may not be changed anymore.
When everybody is ready the player lifts the cup again and puts it aside so the dice result is visible for all players again.
Now everybody values his result and writes the points in the corresponding field (Example Kim see valuation). Pass the cup on in clockwise direction. The next round starts. Important: Sometimes the dice lie on top of each other. Then the dice roll must be repeated immediately!


VALUATION AND EXAMPLES

Who has chosen „count fours only“ in the upper part, multiplies the number of fours with 4 (of fives with 5, of sixes with 6). E.g. three time 4: 3 x 4 = 12 points
Who has set a cross for a colour, e.g. „blue“, in the middle part, only counts the eyes of the two dice in this colour and notes down the sum. Scoring of Kim 5 + 6 = 11 points
Who has chosen „double“, may note down 10 points for each „double“ of the same colour. E.g. one „double“ (red) = 10 points
Who has marked „all ones, twos and threes“, adds all dice pips which show ones, twos and threes. E.g. 1 + 1 + 1 + 2 + 2 + 3 + 3 = 13 points
Who has chosen „DICE CUP“, adds the pips of all dice and


notes down the sum. E.g. 1 + 1 + 1 + 2 + 2 + 3 + 3 + 4 + 4 + 4 +5 + 6 = 36 points After each valuation the respective selected category * The dot next to the red square is used for better is of course dropped for the current game.

END OF THE GAME
The game ends after 12 played rounds. In the last round the cup can be left aside after the third playing step, and the last valuation (for the respective individual last category) is done at once. Afterwards every player adds the points of the three parts on his scoring sheet, transmits the sum into the fields provided for this purpose and calculates the total amount.
The player with the highest total amount wins the DICE CUP-Challenge!

VARIATIONS:
The „Eyes up time“ may vary as the players like or by experience. Pro players can shorten the time to 2 seconds, for example. Beginners and younger players may extend it. All players always have the same length of time available … It is also much fun to play several games simultaneously. The players have two or more columns in each category to fill in and value.

Have fun playing!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: White Elephant: A Gift Exchange
boardgame.description:
White Elephant is a negotiation game featuring a gift economy system. In White Elephant, you pass gifts around and collect the most items you can. Be the one who scores the most items in your group of friends.

The deck of gifts contains an assortment of cards with one, two, or three gifts, among six different types. The game starts by randomly determining play order by shuffling and dealing out the player aid cards, which have the numbers one through six on the back. The play order stays the same throughout play. Players create two score sheets, one for each of the left and right hand neighbors at the table. At the end of the game, each player will receive points for the number of gifts shown on the cards they collect for each of the scoring categories on the score sheet. Before play, decide whether the play will be "generous" or "greedy."

Beginning with the first player and proceeding in order, turn gifts face-up from the top of the draw pile until there are six or more gift icons showing. Choose who will get which cards. In "generous" mode, you must give away all but one card (but may give away all of them). In "greedy" mode, you must give away at least one card (but may give away as many more as you like, up to all of them). Players negotiate and make suggestions about who should get which cards, but ultimately, the current player decides. You cannot refuse a gift.

At the end of the round, count up the number of each kind of icon, and score points for each according to how your neighbors filled out the two score sheets they passed to you, except that you don't score any points for the type of icon you collected the most.

boardgame.name: Johnny Bravo: Date-O-Rama!
boardgame.description:
(from the back cover of the PS2 game)
Wannabe stud Johnny Bravo is thrilled he's invited to appear on the game show Hukka Mega Mighty Ultra Extreme Date-o-Rama to try and win a dream date with a hot chick, but even with his self-professed stunning good looks, incredible strength, and superior intelligence he has his work cut out for him to win the competition.

Can you beat your rival studs and get the girl in this side-splitting action game based on the hit Cartoon Network series?

boardgame.name: No More Valentine: Operation Squarepeg
boardgame.description:
A small postcard game on the landing operations by the US and New Zealand forces on Nissan Island, the Green Islands, on February 15, 1944 (operation Squarepeg).

The game features a standard "I go-you go" mechanics but with unlimited movement subject to fatigue (the more you move, the higher the possibility of being fatigued). The NZ player must conquer the objective hex or eliminate all Japanese units in 5 turns; otherwise, the Japanese player wins.

boardgame.name: Maze Action
boardgame.description:
(from the back cover of European PS2 version of the game)
Show no mercy. Take no prisoners. Power is justice. The ultimate in head-to-head warfare begins as you make your way through battle arenas. Gather keys that are randomly scattered as you defeat and crush your adversaries.
- trap, punch and kick opponents and use an array of weapons
- win battles to unlock up to 12 unique costumes for each warrior
- select from a variety of combat stages and destroy everyone and become a champion
boardgame.videogameversion: Simple 2000 Ultimate Vol. 8: Gekitou! Meiro King

boardgame.name: Fantastic Pop Trivia: Questions from Every Decade
boardgame.description:
Pop Trivia game comes with all you need for a trivia challenge of epic proportions! Simply slip off the lid, pull out a card, roll the die and off you go!

Featuring questions from the last six decades, Pop Trivia covers every aspect of popular culture from flares to feng shui, Beatlemania to breakdancing...as well as questions on the music we all enjoy too!

Pop Trivia is the ideal game for those who remember the good old days...with a smile!

—description from the back of the box

boardgame.name: Iwoká: La Tierra sin Mal
boardgame.description:
The game is called Iwoká: La Tierra sin Mal (The land without evil). It is played on the space of a board, between two players: one will be the Tupi-Guarani aboriginal people, and the other the viceroy with his army. But, while the game is played, the competitors -due to the characteristics of entertainment- will be invited to walk the path of historical knowledge; they will be able to know the circumstances of the time; the rituals, legends and cosmogonies of the aborigines; They will be able to delve into the war iconography of the time, the weapons and ships of the conquerors, their war tactics, etc. And, also, some continental geography.

Two players or teams can play the Iwoká from the age of 9. One will be the Tupi-Guarani people, and the other will be the viceroy and his army. It is played with green and brown chips, in circular movements. On the board the most important place is the center called Arete (the promised land of the aboriginal people). The viceroy is occupying this sacred place: his objective will be to leave through four paths or exit points, from the center to the outside of the board, and flee by ship with the stolen riches. In the escape, he will be protected by his army.

The Tupi-Guarani, who are around the Arete, have the mission of preventing the viceroy and his army from escaping with his riches. How do they prevent the flight of the conquerors? Enclosing them with tokens. The army can be "eaten" with the tokens and eliminated, but the viceroy must be locked up with the tokens.

The invaders win if the viceroy reaches any of the four starting squares, and flee with the riches. The natives win if the viceroy is trapped between tiles.
