Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Cute Puzzle
Cute Puzzle MAX
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A Minesweeper type of puzzle game where you will reveal images of anime girls.

There are three levels in the free version and 15 in the paid version Cute Puzzle MAX.

boardgame.name: Naked Story (Sports Festival Ver)
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A merger of Naked Story and Cute Puzzle: It features artwork from Naked Story but the gameplay is the Minesweeper puzzles from Cute Puzzle.

There are 14 levels to go through.

boardgame.name: Hiroba
boardgame.description:
Win the game of Hiroba by shrewdly placing your numbered pebbles so you can take control of the most gardens. As in Sudoku, you must never have two pebbles of identical value in the same garden, row or column. Beat your opponents by thinking strategically, but don’t neglect the highly coveted Koi, which can earn you precious points.

Will you be able to retain control and stay Zen in the face of your opponents?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Pyramiland
boardgame.description:
Your challenge in Pyramiland is to rid yourself of the balls in your collection first.

To set up, place up to sixty pegs in the holes of the wooden game board to create the field of play, and give each player the same number of wooden balls. On a turn, you place a ball on the playing area, then you can play again if you can place a ball so that it touches the ball just placed while also being on a higher level. You can continue to take extra turns so long as you can do this.

When you place on the lowest level, your ball must be supported by four wooden pegs. On the second level and higher, your ball just needs to be supported by other balls, but due to the layout of the pegs, not all of the balls will be in identical rows, so you likely won't have a clean, regular-shaped pyramid as you build to higher levels.

Whoever places their final ball first wins. If a player cannot place a ball or knocks a ball from the pyramid, including one just placed, the game ends, that player loses, and whoever has the fewest balls remaining wins.

boardgame.name: Civilisations
boardgame.description:
Civilisations is a card game about building competing ancient civilisations over three Ages
Each Age has a different deck of cards. At the start of the game the first Age is divided into a number of hands equal to the number of players plus an extra hand which is set aside.
The set aside hand means that the card mix if different for each game, creating a strong replay value.
Each player then chooses a card from their hand and these cards are played simultaneously, paid for with Gold from your civilisations treasury.
Most cards have Military and/or Culture values and all cards have a special effect. When the card is played the special effect is resolved. These effects do things like enhancing other cards already in play, scoring extra points for certain cards, making certain types of cards cheaper to buy, removing or stealing cards from opponents and a host of other things to.
Some special effects are triggered by circumstances and if not triggered when played will wait until a later turn when their trigger condition is met.
Cards which target other players usually target a random card and/or a random player to prevent players ganging up one someone and ruining their fun.
After playing a card, hands are passed round the table clockwise, giving you new options and choices to make.
Once each player has played 6 cards the Age ends and the player with the card with the highest single Military score gains a Colonisation culture bonus and then players may choose to declare War on each other. Winning a war gets you a small amount of gold but, more importantly, destroys a random card from your opponent.
At the end of the third Age Culture scores are added up to find out who won.
The game was written with the following in mind:

A game should take 1-2 hours (my attention span now is about 2 hours.. age is great :)
The game can be played on a card or kitchen table
Set-up and take down time for a game is less than 5 minutes
You don't need to refer to the rulebook in play, everything you need to know is on the cards (e.g. card abilities are clearly explained in plain english)
There is a degree of randomness which stops players ganging up on other players
The game allows direct (war and espionage) and indirect competition (choosing cards which you know your opponent would like)
No one gets "knocked out" or falls so far behind as not to be able to win. Games are nearly always very close.
Every decision is interesting and important, you will nearly always want to play more than one of the cards in your hand and have to choose which very carefully
Choosing cards which interact with each other in positive ways is critical to victory, but the swapping of hands requires some careful forethought on what cards to play and when and also allows you to mess with your opponents by playing cards they want!
Each game is unique and you have to adapt to the cards you are given


The core game focuses on the region around the Mediterranean sea and Carthage, the Celts, Greece, Rome, Persia and Egypt as playable civilisations.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The 50 States Game
boardgame.description:
How well do you really know the USA? This game will vastly improve your knowledge while introducing the thrill of competition and a great deal of fun between friends and family.

Each player gets two state sheets - five states per sheet. The first player that fills ONE sheet wins the game. Player gets cards by either competing with facts (Area, Population, Highest point, Avg. temperatre) or either wining challenges. Challenge can be called by player that's on turn and holding a weak card - lower fact values and is decided by dice roll.

boardgame.name: Coopolis
boardgame.description:
Coopolis, the game of cooperatives is the result of our exploration of dynamic and innovative educational resources and has been declared by the Legislature of the Autonomous City of Buenos Aires of Interest in matters of Cooperativism and Education, for its contributions to the dissemination of the values ​​of cooperation, solidarity and collective work (Declaration no. 148-2014 / File 1043-D-2014).

Coopolis is a creative and dynamic educational game designed to introduce the growing cooperative economy. In Coopolis, players must work together to found and run a democratic company. To develop as individuals and to strive for the success of their cooperative, they must make decisions, while putting their teamwork skills to the test through familiar and entertaining games such as "mimic it", "taboo" and "draw it". Yes you can". This is an exciting game of skill and solidarity, where everyone wins or everyone loses. By playing Coopolis, we learn about the unique benefits, challenges, and how the co-op world works.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Death by Chocolate
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The villagers of Oar’s Rest are in an uproar. The last chocolate delivery is running late, and the sweet shop had to close! Brave adventurers are needed to solve this sweet crisis.

A Two-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.

CONTENT WARNING: Chocolate, fudge, candy
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Warmis: Mujeres en Lucha
boardgame.description:
This game that has the purpose of making visible and spreading the leading role that Latin American women have had in the construction of a different world, in the struggle to defend the rights of the oppressed peoples and classes.

Transforming in each of its steps the history of the entire continent, breaking barriers, in no hurry to lose calm until patriarchy and capitalism fall.

It is three games in one, or three modes to play with the same cards.

The first mode "Allies", each player must summon Allies to add more voices and defeat the Patriarchy.

The deck of cards is taken and they will be revealed one at a time.

On their turn, each player can choose to take refuge with their Allies, or stay in the streets to gather more voices, but be careful, since the same deck can leave Violence cards, which will stop us in the fight for freedom.

Violence cards include, Repression, Disappearance, Indifference, Capitalism, and Patriarchy. If one of these cards appears, we will be at risk, but we can continue fighting, if a second card appears, we will lose all the Allies that we had gathered that round.

The second mode "United" is a very dynamic game in real time, where we will try to collect all the cards of the same fighter as quickly as possible, to get all the characteristics of each one, and to put an end to the disinformation of their stories. .

We will have 7 different cards in our hands, and we will have to exchange cards with other players, with the only limitation that all the cards delivered must be from the same Fighter. The player who manages to collect the 7 cards of the same Fighter first, will be the winner.

Finally, the third modality "Abya Yala", is a cooperative game where we will try to reconstruct the story. For which we will have to put together a timeline ordering from smallest to largest the year in which the women who have fought to defend the rights of our peoples throughout the continent were born.

But with a twist, since we will play with our cards upside down, so that we can only see the back of our cards, but we can see all the cards in hand of our partners.

In turn, we will have to give clues to the other players about the cards in their hand, and thus be able, together, to put together the correct time lines.

A lot of memory, a lot of commitment, in a beautifully illustrated game, with great quality components, which will help us become aware and build knowledge for the construction of a different, fairer and more inclusive society.

boardgame.name: Lark: A Game of Challenge & Chance
boardgame.description:
-Abundance Through Play-

Lark is a party game for venturesome people. Players challenge each other to get out of their comfort zones in fun and affirming ways using challenge prompt cards and the roll of a 12-sided die.

How to play: Players all draw four cards. One Player (the Dealer) chooses a prompt from her cards or makes up her own for one or more Players and assigns the odds of it happening using the 12-sided die. If Players consent to the challenge and odds, the Dealer rolls the die and the play either commences or not. Regardless of the outcome, the Player who accepted the challenge becomes the new Dealer. Discard and draw a new card when you've played both prompts on your card. Play Wild Cards when it suits you. Incorporate as many variations and inspirations as you like. Be adventurous. Be good to each other. Dealers can prompt one or every play with every turn, including themselves.

On winning and losing: Traditionally, the gameplay is not competitive. However, for those who like the added tension, players can win by collecting points for consenting to a proposal IF and ONLY IF they are not then required to perform the feat based on the role of the die. The first player to 15 points wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: La Aventura de Olivia y Cukito
boardgame.description:
Cooperative game. Scour the neighborhood to find what each project calls for before time runs out. The challenges will be proposing different complexities. The ticking clock will be a very important factor to add excitement and fun!

Olivia and Cukito's adventure is the ninth title that we have produced from El Espejo, and it is of great importance to us as it is our first specifically cooperative proposal. It is an invitation to the game for early childhood, with a neighborhood theme where we seek to work on the issue of waste, trying to problematize the idea of ​​"individual environmentalism" (see section), emphasizing the importance of cooperative work and proposing as a challenge build works or "manufacturable" objects from said waste. With the premise of promoting group work, throughout the game the challenges intensify in difficulty and in the forms of communication between the players.

Olivia, along with Cukito and her friends, are thinking about what to do with so much waste that is scattered around their neighborhood. It occurred to them to put together Projects to recycle, turning some waste into useful objects or reusing them in different ways. To achieve this, they must move at full speed, locker by locker, lifting those elements that serve to complete the projects.

boardgame.name: 18Svea
boardgame.description:
18Svea is one of the smallest and fastest 18XX games around with less than two hours playtime taking place on a map with only ten hexes in total. Designed for two or three players.

The players are railroad entrepreneurs who foresee an opportunity to make money by establishing and running railroad companies developing a railroad network centered around the middle part of Sweden from 1850 and onwards. The game contains five fictional train companies based in different Swedish cities on the map.

A game of 18Svea follows a fixed set of rounds. Four Stock Rounds (SR) when players manage their private shareholder investments in available train companies mixed with seven Operations Rounds (OR) when train companies expand their rail network, establish train stations, run trains, and generate money to its shareholders. The game also contains eight strategy cards which ensures that every game will be different. When the game ends, the player with highest combined wealth in money and company shares wins the game.

18Svea is heavily inspired by the fantastic 18XX train games originally developed or inspired by Francis Tresham and do not normally involve dice rolling or other random events during play. Apart from shuffling the deck of strategy cards and potentially rolling one die once when determining the placement of an off-board connection, players must rely on their own ability to outwit and outmaneuver each other while playing. In 18Svea the luck factor is small, and the player interaction factor is very high already from round one.

listing.notes: 18Svea complete pnp files sent from designer. Option: Pack of tailored wooden game components; discs, trains and stickers via mail for + 5 Euro (+shipping. Normally 2,5 Euro to Europe, US)

boardgame.name: Lark: Happy Hour Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
An expansion pack for Lark: a game of challenge & chance that will elevate your next social night of drinks and carousing.

This expansion pack blends seamlessly into the Lark main game and adds 64 prompts & 5 more wild cards that work best when you and your friends are sharing a drink or a social night on the town.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Lark: A Game of Challenge & Chance

listing.notes: Here's the Lark Happy Hour Expansion Pack with 64 more Prompts and 5 more Wild Cards that will elevate your next social night of drinks and carousing!

boardgame.name: En la Punta de la Lengua!: Versión Difícil
boardgame.description:
A game where laughter and creativity come from the tip of your tongue.

Teams are assembled and the game begins. When it is your turn, you have to give clues so that your classmates guess the secret word (the one that is underlined), but without saying any of the words that appear on the card (or their family of words). WATCH OUT! That the opposing team will be monitoring you.

boardgame.name: En la Punta de la Lengua!: Versión Jóvenes
boardgame.description:
A game where laughter and creativity come from the tip of your tongue.

Teams are assembled and the game begins. When it is your turn, you have to give clues so that your classmates guess the secret word (the one that is underlined), but without saying any of the words that appear on the card (or their family of words). WATCH OUT! That the opposing team will be monitoring you.

boardgame.name: Old School Blue Map #04
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This PDF contains Old School Blue Map #4. The PDF has multiple layers allowing the options for numbered/non-numbered areas, secret doors on/off, and grid/no grid and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

boardgame.name: Old School Blue Map #03
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This PDF contains Old School Blue Map #3. The PDF has multiple layers allowing the options for numbered/non-numbered areas, secret doors on/off, and grid/no grid and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

Publisher's blurb:

The January 21, 2022 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

Publisher's blurb:

The January 28, 2022 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

Publisher's blurb:

The February 4, 2022 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

Publisher's blurb:

The February 11, 2022 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

boardgame.name: Lawman
boardgame.description:
A Roleplaying Game About Interstellar Bounty Hunters And Shooting People For Money

Publisher's blurb:

Lawman is a tabletop roleplaying game set in the far distant future year of AC 20406 (Nobody remembers what the AC stands for, nor does it really matter.) in the explored Galactic Core of Space.

Old Urf, as it was known, and its originating systems have been lost to time, and now, pretty much everybody carries on like it never really existed, nor does it really matter at this point.

boardgame.name: Lawman: The Minimalist Version
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It's Lawman. One Page.
Everything you need to play.
Condensed and Simple.

- a Haiku


This is the no frills, no art, everything you need to know about the game mechanically, but missing all of the lore and fluff to play a game. It also serves as a great and helpful game aid for the CF20 system for new players.

boardgame.name: Wizards + B*llcrap
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A man in a wizard costume is Piiiiiiiiissed off - and is holding hostages in the depths of his sanctum of Wizardly Deliberations. You and your crew have the call. Do you have the might, magic and mettle to best him at his own game?

boardgame.name: Terms May Apply
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Terms May Apply is an introductory Lawman Adventure for 2-4 players, going through the basics of their first day on the job as a freelance bounty hunter with Sirius Hypercorporation. Learn the ropes! Do some paperwork! Deal with a raging psychopath hell-bent on killing everything on the station!

Starting a new career has never been so exciting and memorable!

boardgame.name: Extranet Megafluencer
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Extranet Megafluencer is a new class of Lawman that doesn't need skill, talent, ability, or any kind of natural saving grace when they've got pure crowd-fueled charisma, charm, or probably some kind of hypercorporate sponsorship. A great class to annoy your table and rack up the f-you points, or even better to put a smarmy, obnoxious (name of internet 'celebrity')-type here for a quick and easy rival.

Includes a few adventure seeds to get your crew engaged!

boardgame.name: The NMPD
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Neo-Metro Police Department are a venerable, corrupt, and a bit slighted organization that's put off by this rise in DIY crime-solving solutions, and unlike you and your crew of Lawmen, have the training in criminology, psychology, forensics, etc to actually do the job more efficiently than you. And they may have a grudge.

Includes a few ideas for inclusions of these retro style crooked cops in your Lawman campaign.

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Spotlight On Hellion Keshik
boardgame.description:
Death From Above. No words better describe Hellion Keshik, the bodyguard Trinary for Clan Goliath Scorpion's saKhan. Few formations conjure terror amongst their enemies more than this assemblage of warriors. Forged from tattered remnants of two Clans, one absorbed and the other abjured, Hellion Keshik welded their disparate philosophies into one. As the tip of the spear for Hellion Galaxy, the Keshik does more than protect the saKhan. These warriors train endlessly and fight savagely like no others in the Scorpion Touman. The Keshik has never tasted defeat, because victory is so sweet.

Spotlight On: Hellion Keshik includes a Unit History, Personalities, Personnel Rosters, Mission Tracks, and data for use with all scales of BattleTech play.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: The Ministry of Peace
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It's no stranger that there's a ton of scum in the galactic core. Every self-respecting part-time Lawman knows that. But, it's also to note that, while you think you're out here doing the right thing, that there's always a bigger fish, more invested and dedicated to doing what they believe is the correct and just thing. The Ministry of Peace, for example, is one such fanatical regime that is willing to go just that extra step of old-testament where you and other Lawmen fear to tread. And man, if you wanna talk about seriously not being able to take a joke, these psychopaths have got your ticket.

Contains all you need for including these puritanical monstrosities in your weekly Lawman game. Includes a few adventure seeds, too!

boardgame.name: The Cult of the Implied, Forseeable Apocalypse
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

From the depths of unknown, dangerous space comes the Cult of the Implied, Forseeable Apocalypse, or whatever they might really be called. They might've been meatpeople? They might be mutants? They might be something else. But they're a real mess, literally and figuratively, and are ready to meet your lawman crew with insane chattering, rusty knives, sneaky tactics, and doom and gloom portents of the end of everything in only the way a dangerous MLM scheme can.

This playable organization of significantly bad guys inspired by Event Horizon have a lot of room to grow on to incorporate your own blend of end of days, body horror mess.

boardgame.name: Stellar Exploration League
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

From the depths of doom sector comes a meatperson group familiar, except, they seem to be slightly more smug in their little uniforms than the likes of you. Brandishing such outlandish concepts as 'Education', "Smarts", "Superior Technology" and an "Enlightened post-scarcity possessionless nightmare society focused on the exploration of self and the stars" or whatever - the Stellar Exploration League is a group of real so-and-sos who think they have the gumption to interject themselves into your best fights and arguments with their 'elevated status' and 'diplomatic reasoning' and the like.

If you enjoy the idea of including characters and organizations from (the OTHER major semi-popular science-fiction exploration based series of television programs), then this might be just the micro-supplement for you, to include in your Lawman group.

Also contains a few adventure seeds!

boardgame.name: Out-Of-Warranty Killaz
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A lot of people assume their robits really, really don't like them. But what if everything from your alarm clock to your ship's fuel cell monitoring station was so sick of your sh*t, they'd be willing to uproot from their servitude and join a gang specifically focused on sending fleshy meatbuckets like you into a smoldering smoky grave?

Skynet meets 1991 style west coast gangsta in this play on self-aware criminal bots ready to make your Lawman crew eat weaponized fusion.

Also has a few adventure seeds to include in your game.

boardgame.name: The Ganconer (Love-Talker)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

I met the love-talker one eve in the glen,
More handsome than all of our handsome young men.
His eyes blacker than sloe, his voice sweeter by far
Than the sound of old Kevin’s pipes by Coolnagar.

Also spelled gean-cánach and gancanagh, the ganconer’s name translates as ‘love-talker’. This human-sized fairy haunts remote valleys and other lonely places, seducing mortals through talk of love.

boardgame.name: Caminando
boardgame.description:
Questions related to daily life, trades, domestic tasks, popular knowledge, ancestral knowledge... all this and much more will accompany us on this path of fun and learning.

Caminando is a quiz game, with varied dynamics where other types of knowledge and skills are rewarded that are not associated (like most quiz games) with academic knowledge. Questions referring to daily life where the knowledge "that plays" is that which we have acquired at work, from grandmothers, on the street, in domestic chores, in the neighbourhood. Caminando proposes us to play from other ways of asking about many kinds of knowledge. Because here all knowledge is valid.

boardgame.name: Little 2 Kingdom
リトル2キングダム (Little II Kingdom)
boardgame.description:
リトル2キングダム (Little II Kingdom) is a 2 player card game from Japan. Players build up a tableau of cards and send units across to fight the opponent and capture their castle.

The designer likens the strategy to Shogi, in that a player must be careful which units are deployed and how they attack with a longer view to win.

Each player has a deck of cards and lays out a castle at the back of their tableau, and a forest at the front of the tableau. There is an empty row between the two cards, and two empty spaces either side (so the tableau is 5 wide by 3 deep).

Each player draws cards and plays them to their tableau. Buildings go to the back row and generate military units. These can advance and attack in different patterns. So one unit might advance like a pawn, another like a knight in Chess. A player wins by successfully attacking the opponents castle.
user summary

boardgame.name: Gira-Gira
boardgame.description: A memory card game where a number of cards are placed face up in a circle and players must memorize them. A tree, flags, ants, the world and an infinity of beautiful images. You will have to remember where each one is to take the cards!

boardgame.name: Adiviná Qué Tengo...
boardgame.description: The object of the game is to get your teammates to guess as many words/images as you have on your cards. To achieve this you have to say everything that comes to mind in relation to that word without naming it. Each card is guessed is a point for the team.

boardgame.name: Fröhliche Rheinfahrt
boardgame.description: The players take turns to roll and move. They start with their Steamship at space 1 in Ludwigshafen. The first player to reach space 55 (Köln) wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

boardgame.name: Foundations of Rome: 5th Player Expansion
boardgame.description:
The 5th Player expansion for Foundations of Rome includes:
19 Deed Cards
1 Player Tray
24 Buildings and Icon tiles
8 Lot markers
6 Monument markers
2 Score cubes
1 Player Aid card

During the Kickstarter campaign the color voted on by backers was yellow.

boardgame.name: Gordon-Bennett-Rennen
Luftballon Wettfahrt
boardgame.description:
The race starts on the small red dot at the gasometer in the lower left corner of the game board. The players take turns to roll and move one space. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The die shows the colors red (upward), black (downward), blue (left or right), green (left half:diagonal up/right half: diagonal down), white (choice move).

The player to reach the furthest red dot at the lower edge of the game board wins the game. If a balloon sets down on a space without a red dot it may begin again at the starting space. The game ends when 3 players have reached a red dot.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Advanced Tobruk 2016: Expansion 3 – Tobruk Perimeter
boardgame.description: Second expansion for the 2016 large-hex reissue of the Advanced Tobruk wargame. As in the case of the first one, the zip bag includes a 2-page Battlefield Walkthough (with the exact same additional rules as Expansion 1), 8 scenarios dated from March 31 through April 14 1941 (the "Enter Rommel" period of the North African Campaign), a small countersheet with German and British AFVs (ATS North Africa Expansion AFVs 2016_1941), two pages with additional AFV cards, and another couple pages with terrain overlays (hills and trench lines).

boardgame.name: Zombie Pirates
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Following the port city of Silverstow being overrun by zombies, one of the vessels that regularly docked there has gone missing. What remains of Silverstow’s leadership wants to retrieve the vessel, various thieves want the bounty of silver it undoubtable carries, and adventurers are going to get involved one way or another.

boardgame.name: Zombie City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The port city of Silverstow has been overrun with zombies! These zombies carry a deadly plague that transforms anyone they bite into a zombie within a few hours. It’s up to our heroes to unravel the mystery of this disease, save the few remaining survivors, and escape the city!

This is a simplified hexcrawl with a mystery that can be dropped into any campaign.

boardgame.name: Krampus Krawl
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A child has been snatched from his bed! Whether out of the kindness of their hearts or for the grieving mother’s promised reward, our heroes have taken up the quest to journey up the frozen Old Nick Mountain, navigate the Silent Grove, and cross the Cookies and Cream Canyon to rescue the child. Can they brave the cold, or will they be crushed by The Krampus?

This is a simplified hexcrawl that can easily be dropped into any campaign.

boardgame.name: Turkey Hunt
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It’s time for the annual Feast of Thankfulness, but the great hunter Grusk has a sprained ankle. It’s up to our heroes to procure the feast’s traditional giant turkey. Time is running out and the wilderness their prey calls home is unforgiving. Can they hunt down the turkey in time, or will they be the turkeys this year?

This is a simplified hexcrawl that can easily be dropped into any campaign.

boardgame.name: Earth Hum Caverns
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Whether for glory, greed, or fate our heroes have entered the Earth Hum Caverns, the underground home of various subterranean beasties. There’s more to these tunnels than it first appears though, and the forces of elemental earth are marshaling throughout. Can they conquer the Caverns, or will elemental earth erode them away?

This is a simple dungeon crawl that can easily be dropped into any campaign with minimal preparation.

boardgame.name: Scroll Heart Tower
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The grand artificer Mibla has been missing for over a hundred days, and more importantly her shop has been closed. Whether to investigate, trade, or loot, our heroes have come to Mibla’s front door. The shop won’t give up its secrets easily though, and the countermeasures the gnomish artificer left in place make things especially tricky. Can they unravel the mystery, or will the constructs within tear them apart?

This is a simple adventure that can easily be dropped into any campaign with minimal preparation. It’s assumed that it takes place in a major city with nobles and magic items to buy, but the meat of the adventure can easily be transferred to any doorway in the world without those trappings.

boardgame.name: Hex Flower Weather
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Weather is always in the background of any adventure that takes place under the open sky, and it’s often a factor even when indoors. It can be just as much of a character as a boisterous nobleman and as much of a challenge as a deadly dragon. The tools in these rules help the Dungeon Master use weather to make their world feel real and dynamic.

What are Hex Flowers?
Hex flowers are essentially tables laid out on a hexagonal grid, making it possible to move in six directions instead of two. Each result is tied to the previous result, making changes seem smooth and natural.

The main hex flower presented here encompass everything to allow you to find the temperature, precipitation, and wind in a single roll no matter the terrain or season. What’s more, it will be related to the previous weather conditions; no more going from a blizzard to a dry heat! It's great for updating the weather each day of your campaign.

boardgame.name: Nonmagical Ranger
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Being the vanguard between the wilds and civilization doesn’t necessarily grant magical abilities. It’s always been weird to me that rangers are so closely tied to magic in 5th edition. This take on the class emphasizes preparation and martial ability, cutting out the magic of the base class while keeping it consistent with existing subclasses.

boardgame.name: Gish Subclasses
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Martial characters perfect their bodies and hone their skills in order to conquer the adventures before them, generally eschewing the arcane for the mundane. A little magic helps every once in a while though, and focused individuals can exploit small amounts of magic in ways more traditional spell slingers wouldn’t think of. The subclasses here are designed around stretching a few magical tricks as far as they’ll go, sometimes outdoing even the most wizened of wizards.

boardgame.name: Thri-Kreen Playable Race
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Everyone's favorite multi-armed elf eating mantis people are here to clack mandibles and lunge across the desert!

boardgame.name: Sci-Fi Hit Point Pools
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A lot of science fiction settings have lightweight ablative armor, regenerating energy shields, and psionic barriers. The rules here offer options for adapting these into your game, either completely or partially.

boardgame.name: Alternative Crafting
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Crafting items allows players to roleplay being self-sufficient, customize their abilities, and progress in a way not directly tied to gaining experience. These rules provide a flexible system to allow players to craft items without having too much to keep track of. It is not a spreadsheet of keywords with specific meanings.

boardgame.name: Alternative Resting
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Six encounters in an adventuring day is hard to fit in smoothly. It’s often just as easy to take a long rest as a short rest, leaving classes based around short rests in the dust. When long rests are infrequent, classes that depend on long rests can start feeling useless. The options presented here provide a smoother rest gradient to allow meaningful choices about resource management.

boardgame.name: Alternative Chases
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The chase rules in the Dungeon Master’s Guide work best on a giant battle map of twisting paths, and even then they can easily overstay their welcome. The rules here are built for quick, abstract, player-focused chase scenes that can be customized with the flavor of the environment.

boardgame.name: Alternative Injuries
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Death is an ending, except when it’s not, that stops fun in its tracks. Some DMs avoid death, only dealing it out when the player agrees and it can be suitably epic. Going down still needs to have a sting though, and these rules provide it. Don’t have an adventure ended by an ignominious death, have it continue despite feeling like death!

boardgame.name: Divine Wild Magic
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Wild magic with a divine influence, ordered so high numbers are beneficial and low numbers are detrimental. Use it for a different flavor of wild magic sorcerer or when in a place bursting with divine energies.

boardgame.name: Primal Wild Magic
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Wild magic with a primal influence, ordered so high numbers are beneficial and low numbers are detrimental. Use it for a different flavor of wild magic sorcerer or when in a place bursting with primal power.

boardgame.name: Wild Psionics
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Wild psionic effects, ordered so high numbers are beneficial and low numbers are detrimental. Use it for a different flavor of wild magic sorcerer or when stumbling through the Far Realm.

boardgame.name: Shadow Wild Magic
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Wild magic with a shadow influence, ordered so high numbers are beneficial and low numbers are detrimental. Use it for a different flavor of wild magic sorcerer or when in a place linked to the Shadowfell.

boardgame.name: 3 Side Quests
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Sword Coast is the home of Waterdeep, the most influential and prominent city of the North of Faerun. Our adventurers are beginning to uncover of a plot to overthrow the government and spread chaos throughout all of Faerun. In the last adventure, they successfully captured the corrupt General Dragonsbane and have him in custody. They bring him back to Waterdeep and Open Lord Silverhand.

In this part of the Sword Coast Coup, our adventurers have just returned from their most recent mission and now can spend some gold, engage in downtime activities, and delve into some roleplay. However, then they will succumb to 1 of 3 possible side quests. One, they must stop an evil ritual of the sea goddess Umberlee. Two, you enter a strange pocket dimension and must win a difficult game. Three, an example of how to engage in a player's backstory.

boardgame.name: Pandemonium & The Tabaxi Bard
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In this part of the Sword Coast Coup, our adventurers become aware of a secret organization called The Golden Circle. They learn that a Knight of Kansair is a part of it, a certain tabaxi bard who they very likely have come into contact with in the past. Samuel Sabbath is chaotic, whimsical, and downright evil. He owns several shops around the Sword Coast specializing in fradulant and counterfeit magical items. But this is more than mere fraud. His influence in the Golden Circle has lasting effects on Waterdeep. Can the players find information about this secret group and discover its ties to Sabbath and therefore to Kansair? And will the players be ready to travel to Pandemonium to confront the evil bard?

boardgame.name: Escape the Crate: The Gold Rush Robbery
boardgame.description:
It’s time to make your return to Rattler Gulch! In 1849, gold was found in the river that runs just North of town and prospectors from all over the country headed to the boom town to make their fortune. Many of these miners found nothing but despair, but a few made out like bandits. One of them was Mr. George Duncan and he became so wealthy that it made him quite the target for thieves. Someone in town made off with his entire score one night and he is offering you quite the reward to figure out whodunnit and return it to him. There are 3 missions in this massive game.

Interview the suspects in town and discover their secrets. Pan for gold and examine the scene of the crime. Prepare to name the thief and recover the lost gold! Just remember that with this much money involved, the culprit won’t go down without a fight.

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

boardgame.name: Escape the Crate: The Roswell Incident
boardgame.description:
Only days after the famous “Roswell Incident” shook the world, another crash was discovered in the desert only miles away. The boss is a bit shaken by the discovery, as this was not supposed to happen in the timeline. When the world finds out about the flying saucer, it will start a panic like we have never seen before. The United States government has contacted you to help “cover-up” the newest crash in this hotbed of UFO activity. You have only a short amount of time to examine the craft, come up with ingenious ways to disguise what happened, and to see if the beings onboard are still alive. You then have to somehow sneak the saucer to a secret government facility without the press snapping a photograph… Sounds easy, right?

This 2 chapter game has 2 separate game experiences. In the 1st chapter, we have a family-friendly, but eerie examination of the crash site. The 2nd chapter is a bit more intense, as you get closer to the aliens onboard. Let’s just hope that they came in peace…

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

boardgame.name: Escape the Crate: Escape the Ruins
boardgame.description:
It is the archaeological find of the century! The fabled lost “Temple of the Crocodile” has been unearthed deep in the jungles and we are sending you in to investigate the find! It is rumored that buried deep inside the temple, there is a secret. One that might change mankind as we know it. EMIT tried to keep the discovery a secret, but our arch-rival, Mr. X, seems to have hacked our systems and is hot on our heels. He has sent his own agents to the temple to challenge you to the find. TWO games await you within this adventure. Find your way through the temple, discovering secret passages in an attempt to gain access to the treasure. Then, try to find a way to escape the temple, as a series of fiendish traps are set against you. That isn’t it, though. Your team will be presented with a choice at the beginning of the game. Play together as one team to beat Mr. X’s agents and find the treasure together as a team OR split into two competing groups. Some players may have the opportunity to join Mr. X and challenge the remainder of the group to see who gets to the treasure first… Will you defeat Mr. X as a team… or will you turn against each other in a chance for eternal glory?

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

boardgame.name: Escape the Crate: Escape From Camelot
boardgame.description:
Four smaller quests await in this legendary adventure. You have been invited to a grand tournament in the legendary Camelot to compete against Sir Lancelot. When you arrive, however, you discover that the kingdom is in chaos. King Arthur has gone missing and the mythical “round table” has been broken into 4 pieces. It is up to you to take on 4 quests to reassemble the table and to restore Camelot to glory. Can you pull the sword from the stone, vanquish a dragon, match wits with Merlin, or battle your way to victory? Encounter characters like Merlin, Guinevere, Mordred, Lancelot, and Morgan Le Fay as you attempt to figure out what is real and what is legend. Be careful though…. with every passing minute, the darkness around Camelot grows.

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

boardgame.name: Escape the Crate: Murders in the Speakeasy
boardgame.description:
Two murder mysteries await in this massive adventure! The year is 1928 and Prohibition is the law of the land. Behind the hidden door to the Blind Hog Saloon, however, drinks are pouring, gambling is rampant, and men and women dance the night away to the Charleston. The owner of the speakeasy, Arthur “Goldie” Nickels, rules the shadows and has made thousands by smuggling and selling alcohol…until he was found murdered. There were only a few suspects around him at the time of his death and it is up to you to find the entrance to the speakeasy, interview the suspects, and to solve the crime. Unfortunately for you, however, there are multiple weapons, motives, and killers to choose from. Even more than that… Goldie is not the only person who will be murdered in the speakeasy tonight. Another murder sets the scene for the second mystery in the box… one where you appear to be the leading suspect. Solve both murders before you find yourself framed for the crime of the century!

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:

boardgame.name: Escape the Crate: Escape from Ice Age Park
boardgame.description:
Two chapters await in this brand new adventure. Your arch-enemy is up to no good again… This time, he has gone back in time and nabbed a bunch of extinct creatures and has opened one of the most exciting theme parks in the world…Ice Age Park. Messing around with time is exactly what you are trying to avoid, so of course you have been sent to the Grand Opening to check it out. After all… who wouldn’t want to play with a baby mammoth? It becomes immediately apparent that some corners were cut with security. Stranded in the middle of a zoo in lockdown, you need to match your wits against mother nature to escape with your very lives! The ice below your feet is cracking, a rhino stampede has taken out the gift shop, and an out of control hot air balloon drifts into the heavens… but nothing compares to the feeling of being hunted. The saber-tooth cats are loose and they are hungry. Fast and cunning, they are hot on your trail and you don’t want to be around when they catch up. Solve the puzzles, crack the codes, and uncover the secrets to get the park back online… and to avoid the jaws of defeat.

boardgame.name: Dominant Species: Meeple Source Marine Upgrade
boardgame.description:
This 140-piece upgrade for Dominant Species: Marine includes 35 small wooden pieces for each of the 4 species.

These replace the cubes of the game.

boardgame.name: War of Conquest
boardgame.description:
The Seven Years' War on a global scale in two volumes. An operational level hex & counter wargame. The first volume, "War of Conquest", covers central Europe. The second volume, "War of Conquest: The Wider World", expands the game to the rest of the world. This is a two player wargame, but if you wish to play in two teams you can, dividing your assets as you see fit. The game can also be played solitaire because, although it uses cards, it is not ‘card driven’ as such.

The base game includes an A1 map of Middle Europe and features unit counters for all those that fight in the main European theatre of war at a regiment or brigade scale. The Wider World expansion adds four more A2 sized maps for Maritime Europe, Latin America, North America, and India, plus extensive named naval units, and numerous colonial units. The Wider World expansion adds naval rules including rules for movement between theatres of war. For the most ambitious players the expansion also includes the Global Grand Campaign that stitches together all theatres of war providing the ultimate bird’s eye view of a world at war.

boardgame.name: Escape the Crate: Escape on the High Seas
boardgame.description:
A great treasure has been taken by some of the most infamous pirates to ever sail the Caribbean, Calico Jack and Anne Bonny. The pair have recently fled the safety of Nassau and are on a spree attacking ships big and small, including other pirate ships. Among their recent takes is an object you need… a time machine, hidden within a chest of gold. It is up to you to infiltrate the crew, gain their trust, and escape with the treasure before they grow wise of your plan. The only issue is that Anne Bonny is not an easy pirate to deceive. Wicked and clever, she sees through your rouse and is ready to make you pay for your deception.

Three separate, shorter games await you in this massive adventure. Each game increases in difficulty, with the first being a nice introduction to escape games and the last being a challenging battle to claim your riches. Use cannons to sink other ships, climb to the highest mast, explore the bowels of the ship, and even sword fight your way to victory!

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

boardgame.name: The Outer Worlds - Murder on Eridanos
boardgame.description:
User Summary

During the events of the main game, you and your crew are summoned to a floating colony on the gas giant Eridanos to investigate the murder of Halcyon Helen, the most famous actress in the Halcyon system. Here, you will discover that the problems on Eridanos run far deeper than the murder of one celebrity as you rub elbows with the Byzantine elite and uncover yet more outrages being perpetuated by Halcyon's leading corporations.

boardgame.name: Dino Deck
boardgame.description:
Taken from back of the box:

Dino-Deck contains 72 cards with 12 colorful dinosaur characters each with 5 symbols about their size, what they ate, and how they walked. Friendly Rex, Claus, Study, Puny, Thor, Lance, Billy, Spike, Packy, Heat Wave, Rolo, and Sarah invite you to play their 5 action-packed card games and learn about dinosaurs.

5 Action-Packed Games:

Meateaters: An exciting game of matching symbols and collecting meat eating dinosaurs!

Dino-Match: Ask your friend for a dinosaur and see if it matches one of yours. If it does -- ask again. When you are out of cards, you win!

Dino-Play: A new fast-paced game of matching card colors and dinosaurs. You get a chance to play 2 cards in 1 turn!

Collect-A-Saurus: A real strategy game. Which card do you choose from your friends' pattern to finish your pattern? Score 100 points and win!

Recall-A-Saurus: How's your memory? This game tests your memory of where the dinosaurs are in a 25 card pattern!"

boardgame.name: Rex
boardgame.description:
The new battling dinosaur bidding game everyone wants to try. As you enter the jungle battle for points with some of the dinosaurs on your side, the struggle will get exciting. When the Royal Juraissteers, King Rex, Prince Don, & Duke Rus get involved, you had better hope that they are also on your team.

The game is played with a deck of 48 cards, containing 3 suits (Rex is red, Don is green, Rus is purple). Each suit consists of 16 cards numbering from 1 to 13 with an addition of 3 royal cards in each suit. The game can be played with 2 to 6 players.

Cards are dealt, player left of dealer is first player and plays a card. All players must follow suit, if they can. If not, they play another. After the dealing of cards, each player is required to bid the number of points they expect to make. If the points made are equal to or greater than their bid, the amount of the bid id added to the score. If the player fails to make their bid, then the bid is deducted from their score.

The first player to reach 500 points wins.

boardgame.name: Escape the Crate: Escape the Ripper
boardgame.description:
For the last few months, the citizens of London have been outraged, appalled, and terrified by the killings of the notorious Jack the Ripper. Stalking the foggy streets of the Whitechapel for fresh victims, the cloaked figure has already killed 5 women and he seems to be ready to murder again. It is up to you to put an end to his reign of terror. Two missions await in this box. The first is a family-friendly mystery in the elegant home of one of the ripper suspects. It is up to you to confirm his identity, uncover hidden passages, and discover his role in this classic escape adventure. The second, however, is a PG-13 adventure that will put you in the dark alleys of London… one step behind the ripper… where you will examine his latest victims and find yourself hot on his trail. Let’s hope that he doesn’t turn his attention on you. It is our scariest mission yet. Can you escape the ripper?

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:

boardgame.name: Escape the Crate: Escape the Moon
boardgame.description:
After 21 missions through time, you have earned yourself a nice vacation. The boss has booked you onboard the spaceship “Apollo 135” in the year 2050 on an all-expense paid trip to the moon! As the spaceship soars out of the atmosphere, it becomes quite clear that not everything has gone according to plan. After a rough landing on the lunar surface, you realize it is up to you to repair the ship before it is too late. With an artificial intelligence system malfunctioning, you have little help making sense of the massive spaceship, but odd clues appear to be have been left on the lunar surface itself. Can you crack the code, repair the ship, and return to Earth or will you be lost in space?

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

boardgame.name: Subsistence
boardgame.description:
Subsistence is a compact resource management game that imagines the world behind the standing stones of Neolithic Britain.

Over nine turns, players select idol cards to gain benefits from. These benefits will be additional cards to add to their tableau, or development tokens to place on their land cards- which may trigger additional benefits. After these nine turns, the game ends. Points are scored based on their idols' unique criteria and the placement of their developments. The player with the highest score wins.

Subsistence plays quickly but offers a growing depth of strategic decision-making. It will appeal to players who enjoy careful planning and progression rather than direct conflict.

boardgame.name: Escape the Crate: The Games of Olympus
boardgame.description:
The 2020 Olympic games may have been postponed, but this summer you can compete against the gods! In this adventure we have several smaller escapes to complete, so you can play the game in smaller spurts than a traditional hour long setting. We are sending you back to Ancient Greece where a false prophet is spoiling future events and changing history in her wake. The only way to stop her prophecies is to compete in the fabled “Games of Olympus.” Each challenge will pit you against the Greek gods, goddesses, monsters, and heroes as you attempt to come out on top. Do you dare enter the maze of the Minotaur, soar into the sky on Apollo’s chariot, face-off against Medusa, or think you can resist the urge to open Pandora’s Box? Win each of the challenges to take on the prophet and restore history to its rightful path. Can you earn the favor of the gods?

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

boardgame.name: Escape the Crate: Escape the Circus Heist
boardgame.description:
Time for the Greatest Heist on Earth! You have a strange mission this time. An extinct animal, known as the Tasmanian Tiger, has been found back in a depression-era circus. It will soon disappear into history, so this is your chance to travel back and steal the creature, thus saving the species. To do so, you will need to pull off a heist of EPIC proportions! Sneak through the circus train, explore the sideshows, avoid the meddling clowns, and try to find a way to plot out the perfect heist. You see… the only way to get the tiger will be to steal it from right under the Ringmaster’s nose and in front of a whole tent of paying customers. Are you able to save the tiger in time… or will you just turn into its next lunch?

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:

boardgame.name: Escape the Crate: Escape the Mardi Gras Murders
boardgame.description:
You have been invited to a Mardi Gras party in the heart of the French Quarter. The other guests have arrived and we are eagerly are awaiting our host… when the murders start. One by one, each of the guests is to meet their end and it is up to you to solve the crime before you become the final victims. Work with your fellow players to solve a series of mindbending puzzles as you work your way through cajun culture and New Orleans lore, but this is also a competition among yourselves. After each puzzle, a different guest is eliminated in an over the top murder… and it is up to you to compete against your opponents to see who can figure out which of the remaining guests committed the crime. See if you can be the first one to solve the case of the “Mardi Gras Murders!”

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:

boardgame.name: Escape the Crate: Escape Alcatraz
boardgame.description:
Two 45 minute escape adventures await you in our holiday box! Our agency is in crisis! The Clockmaker, head of EMIT, has been framed and locked up in the world famous prison known as Alcatraz. The place is said to be the most secure prison on Earth, with many escape attempts proving to be failures. That is where you come in… You have 2 missions to complete. First, find a way to escape your jail cell before the guards notice you are missing. Clues are hidden everywhere, along with the tools you will need to get out. The second mission asks you to do the impossible: Rescue the boss and find a way to escape the island itself. The search light is always watching for you and the bay is known to hold Great White sharks… yet this escape attempt is your only option to save our agency and perhaps the entire world.

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

boardgame.name: Escape the Crate: Escape the Mothman
boardgame.description:
In this eerie, yet family friendly, escape adventure, we are sending you back in time to the quiet town of Point Pleasant, West Virginia. At first glance, it seems like the least likely place in the world for something sinister to happen. However, in 1966-1967 the small town was rocked by the appearance of a mysterious creature…one known as the Mothman. With large wings, glowing red eyes, and the aura of danger hovering around it, the creature roamed the woods and the skies. We are sending you back to 1967 to investigate claims of a Mothman sighting where your name was brought up by the creature. An abandoned cabin holds the secrets you need, where the radio crackles with incomprehensible codes and strange men in black suits stalk the streets waiting for your arrival. You only have an hour to explore the cabin, piece together the evidence, and escape before you end up disappearing into the night.

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:

boardgame.name: Escape the Crate: Quest for the Lost City
boardgame.description:
This is no ordinary treasure hunt. This is not the city of gold… this is something much bigger than that. The Incan Empire was one of the most mysterious civilizations the world has ever known and it holds one of the largest secrets. The lost city of Patiti was said to be a massive city filled with gold, jewels, and priceless treasures. Tucked away in the lush jungles of Peru, the city has claimed the lives of many explorers who have tried to find the path, but they never held the secret you do. A mysterious package has been delivered to us from the Vatican filled with maps and tools used by Spanish conquistadors. It appears the lost city had been found before… and with the maps in your possession, you have the chance to find it again. In this combination treasure hunt and escape room, you must unravel the path, decode the secrets, and survive the quest, with danger lurking only steps behind.

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

boardgame.name: Escape the Crate: Escape the World's Fair Killer
boardgame.description:
Two 45 Minute Escape Adventures await in this box! Your mission takes you back to the 1893 World’s Fair in Chicago, where you will have a choice to make. One Escape Adventure is a Family Friendly exploration through the fair which introduced the Ferris Wheel, Cracker Jacks, and many other iconic inventions as you search out a misplaced object in time. Will you be able to discover all of the secrets of the World’s Fair? The other Escape Adventure, however, takes a darker turn. HH Holmes, America’s first Serial Killer, set up a hotel near the World’s Fair and rigged its rooms with a variety of traps to ensnare his victims. Step into his hotel and dare to avoid the traps and escape in time. Will you escape or become his next victim? Both games are included in this next adventure to play separately or together!

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

boardgame.name: Escape the Crate: Secret Agent
boardgame.description:
It is time for a covert operation, agents. Our arch-rival, Mr. X, is said to be building a sort of a time bomb back in the late 1960’s. Our intel is that the plans for this bomb, as well as how to disarm it, can be found buried in the files in a skyscraper run by Mr. X. We need you to infiltrate the tower, avoiding security, and to make your way to the very top. Uncover everything you can about his dastardly plans and escape the tower before you can be compromised. Then, use what you discovered to determine the location of the attack. It will be up to you to find and disarm the bomb before it detonates. If we do not stop Mr. X’s plans, the consequences could be disastrous. In this family-friendly spy adventure, you have two games to complete in the box, facing twists and turns… traitors and cliffhangers… Work your way higher and higher up the tower to discover all of the plans in time.

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.
