boardgame.name: Sheboygan-opoly
boardgame.description:
Monopoly with a unique Sheboygan twist. Don't eat too many onion rings at the Charcoal Inn!

Each game is a walk around a specific town and the board spaces are the buildings, local businesses and traditions that are special to that town.

Follows traditional Monopoly rules.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company

boardgame.name: Akropolis
boardgame.description:
The most talented architects in ancient Greece stand ready to achieve this goal. Build housing, temples, markets, gardens and barracks, so you can grow your city and ensure it triumphs over the others. Raise its prestige with harmonious planning that conforms to specific rules, and enhance it by building plazas.

Stone is an essential resource, so make sure you do not neglect it. You’ll need enough quarries so you can build higher up, making your city stretch towards the sky.


Choose a tile from the construction site
Arrange it in your city to unlock each district's full potential
Build on higher levels, increase the value of your districts and win the game


—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2022 UK Games Expo Best Family Game Judges Award Winner
2022 UK Games Expo Best Family Game Nominee
2022 UK Games Expo Best Family Game People's Choice Award Winner

boardgame.name: Smart10 Frågekort 3
Smart10: Kysymykset 3
Smart10: Neue Fragen 3.0
boardgame.description:
200 new questions, 2,000 new answers - the expansion "New Questions 3.0" brings further challenges for quiz fans with additional questions on different topics.

For all Smartboxes of the Smart 10 series, there is even more variety with the "New Questions 3.0" extension. The sequel for exciting quiz evenings has 200 new questions and thus 2,000 possible answers. As in the original game, the topics here are wide-ranging and can make the two to eight players, ages 14 and up, ponder: Which US Presidents died in office: Kennedy, Roosevelt and/or perhaps Eisenhower? What are the first names of the rock guitarists from Led Zeppelin or Police and in which country were Formula 1 world champions like Vettel or Lauda born?

There are ten answer options to choose from for each question, which are covered with markers. Whoever has a turn chooses one of them, checks whether it is correct and passes the smart box on to the next player. If you don't want to give an answer anymore, it's better to pass, because if you get it wrong, you lose all the points you have collected in the current round. Who knows the right answers or guesses and gambles best?

The pack contains 100 double-sided expansion cards with new questions and can also be mixed with the cards from the original game.

Only playable with the Smartbox from the original game!

—description from the publisher (translated)

200 neue Fragen, 2.000 neue Antworten – die Erweiterung „Neue Fragen 3.0“ bringt mit Zusatzfragen zu unterschiedlichen Themengebieten weitere Herausforderungen für Quizfans.

Für alle Smartboxen der Smart 10-Reihe gibt es noch mehr Abwechslung durch die Erweiterung „Neue Fragen 3.0“. Die Fortsetzung für spannende Quizabende hält 200 neue Fragen und damit 2.000 Antwortmöglichkeiten bereit. Wie im Originalspiel sind die Themen hier breit gefächert und können die zwei bis acht Spieler ab 14 Jahren ganz schön ins Grübeln kommen lassen: Welche US-Präsidenten sind im Amt verstorben: Kennedy, Roosevelt und/oder vielleicht Eisenhower? Wie heißen die Rock-Gitarristen von Led Zeppelin oder Police mit Vornamen und in welchem Land wurden Formel 1-Weltmeister wie Vettel oder Lauda geboren?

Pro Frage stehen zehn Antwortmöglichkeiten zur Wahl, die mit Markern abgedeckt sind. Wer an der Reihe ist, wählt eine davon aus, kontrolliert, ob’s stimmt und gibt die Smartbox an den nächsten Spieler weiter. Wer keine Antwort mehr geben will, sollte besser passen, denn wer falsch liegt, verliert alle Punkte, die er in der laufenden Runde gesammelt hat. Wer weiß die richtigen Antworten oder rät und zockt am besten?

Die Packung beinhaltet 100 beidseitig bedruckte Zusatzkarten mit neuen Fragen und kann auch mit den Karten aus dem Originalspiel gemischt werden.

Nur spielbar mit der Smartbox aus dem Originalspiel!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Smart10: Historia
Smart10: History
boardgame.description:
100 new questions, 1,000 new answers from the History section!

The “History” theme edition is ideal for anyone who is familiar with history. Simply exchange the 100 new questions with half the deck of cards from the Smartbox of the original game or the Family Edition and nothing stands in the way of further exciting quiz rounds.

Questions such as "Which Greek deity is responsible for sleep?", which countries were members of the Warsaw Pact or whether the 100-year war ended in the 15th or 16th century are sure to make history professionals from the age of 14 ponder or encourage gambling.

There are ten answer options to choose from for each question, which are covered with markers. Whoever has a turn chooses one of them, checks whether it is correct and passes the smart box on to the next player. If you don't want to give an answer anymore, it's better to pass, because if you get it wrong, you lose all the points you have collected in the current round. Who knows the right answers or guesses and gambles best?

The pack contains 50 double-sided cards with new questions and answers for even more fun.

Only playable with the Smartbox from the original game!

—description from the publisher (translated)

100 neue Fragen, 1.000 neue Antworten aus dem Bereich Geschichte!

Für alle, die in Geschichte fit sind, bietet sich die Themenedition „History“ an. Einfach die 100 neuen Fragen mit dem halben Kartensatz aus der Smartbox des Originalspiels oder der Family Edition tauschen und schon steht weiteren spannenden Quizrunden nichts mehr im Weg.

Fragen wie „Welche griechische Gottheit ist zuständig für den Schlaf?“, welche Staaten waren Mitglied im Warschauer Pakt oder ob das Ende des 100-jährigen Kriegs im 15. oder 16. Jahrhundert war, lassen Geschichtsprofis ab 14 Jahren sicher teilweise ins Grübeln kommen oder zum Zocken animieren.

Pro Frage stehen zehn Antwortmöglichkeiten zur Wahl, die mit Markern abgedeckt sind. Wer an der Reihe ist, wählt eine davon aus, kontrolliert, ob’s stimmt und gibt die Smartbox an den nächsten Spieler weiter. Wer keine Antwort mehr geben will, sollte besser passen, denn wer falsch liegt, verliert alle Punkte, die er in der laufenden Runde gesammelt hat. Wer weiß die richtigen Antworten oder rät und zockt am besten?

Die Packung beinhaltet 50 beidseitig bedruckte Karten mit neuen Fragen und Antworten für noch mehr Spielvergnügen.

Nur spielbar mit der Smartbox aus dem Originalspiel!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Smart10: Entertainment
Smart10: Underhållning
Smart10: Viihde
boardgame.description:
100 new questions, 1,000 new answers about entertainment!

Are you looking for a change from the popular and award-winning quiz game Smart 10 and want to shine as a movie junkie? Then the 100 new questions in the theme edition "Entertainment", which can be traded with half the deck of cards from the smart box of the original game or the Family Edition, are ideal for you!

Questions are asked here about the cast of well-known TV series, but also about the 50 most visited websites. Who can sort Apple products by year of release and know or guess the characters from "Toy Story"? Quiz rounds will definitely be entertaining with the 100 new themed questions!

There are ten answer options to choose from for each question, which are covered with markers. Whoever has a turn chooses one of them, checks whether it is correct and passes the smart box on to the next player. If you don't want to give an answer anymore, it's better to pass, because if you get it wrong, you lose all the points you have collected in the current round. Who knows the right answers or guesses and gambles best?

The pack contains 50 double-sided cards with new questions and answers for even more fun.

Only playable with the Smartbox from the original game!

—description from the publisher (translated)

100 neue Fragen, 1.000 neue Antworten rund um Entertainment!

Ihr sucht etwas Abwechslung für das beliebte und mehrfach ausgezeichnete Quizspiel Smart 10 und wollt als Film-Junkies glänzen? Dann sind die 100 neuen Fragen in der Themenedition „Entertainment“, die mit dem halben Kartensatz aus der Smartbox des Originalspiels oder der Family Edition getauscht werden können, ideal für euch!

Gefragt wird hier nach den Besetzungen bekannter TV-Serien, aber auch nach den 50 am meisten besuchten Webseiten. Wer kann Apple-Produkte nach dem Erscheinungsjahr sortieren und kennt oder rät die Figuren aus „Toy Story“? Unterhaltsam werden Quizrunden mit den 100 neuen Themenfragen auf jeden Fall!

Pro Frage stehen zehn Antwortmöglichkeiten zur Wahl, die mit Markern abgedeckt sind. Wer an der Reihe ist, wählt eine davon aus, kontrolliert, ob’s stimmt und gibt die Smartbox an den nächsten Spieler weiter. Wer keine Antwort mehr geben will, sollte besser passen, denn wer falsch liegt, verliert alle Punkte, die er in der laufenden Runde gesammelt hat. Wer weiß die richtigen Antworten oder rät und zockt am besten?

Die Packung beinhaltet 50 beidseitig bedruckte Karten mit neuen Fragen und Antworten für noch mehr Spielvergnügen.

Nur spielbar mit der Smartbox aus dem Originalspiel!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Piesku, szukaj domu
boardgame.description:
Educational game for children. It shows the fate of homeless dogs, both those living on the street and those that ended up in animal shelters.
A dog running in the streets may be caught by the guards. By throwing the dice, we check if he has a chip with an address. If he has, he goes to the owner. If not, he ends up in a shelter. A homeless dog can also run into a car, and then goes to the vet for treatment. If he has a chip, it returns to the owner, if not, he goes to the shelter. The dice rolls decide about the events. Someone can come to the shelter to get the dog. A dog from a shelter can also appear on television and attract attention so that someone adopts he.
The winner is the player whose first four dogs (pawns) find a home.

The game is co-financed by the "Program for the care of homeless animals and prevention of animal homelessness in the capital city of Warsaw" prepared by the Environmental Protection Office of the Warsaw City Hall.

boardgame.name: My Best Chef
マイベストシェフ
boardgame.description:
My Best Chef is a multi-action card game that earns resources by efficiently working more than 50 types of staff working in restaurants.

As the restaurant manager, your goal is to gather the resources to hire staff, get more resources by working them, hire better staff and create a highly regarded restaurant.

The staff are all unique cards.
Cards that can be adopted range from cooking staff, including chefs who cook food at restaurants, to staff who provide the necessary customer service, purchasing, and recruitment for the store, and staff who manage disposal.

The main point of this game is to collect resources in cooperation with the staff of each department.

Another point is the "disposal token".

This represents the garbage (waste) of the ingredients that are generated when the staff works at the restaurant. Care must be taken as overworking and accumulating waste will damage the restaurant's reputation, resulting in loss of ratings and dismissal of staff.

In order to solve these problems, it is necessary to hire management staff to dispose of waste and keep the store clean.

boardgame.name: Tales from the Darkwood Part 1: Ghosts of Pinebrook
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Tales from the Darkwood! A new adventure series rooted in dark classic fantasy with a bit of a goofy and modern edge.

This series is designed to be a fully linked adventure that will build connections with each new installment in the series. Ultimately, an entire new region called the Darkwood will be detailed in this six part series. Darkwood has towns, cities, sprawling wilderness, and plenty of adventure sites to explore for players and game masters alike!

Although the series is designed to be connected, all the individual adventures can be run as complete modules that you can throw into an existing campaign however you as a game master see fit!

Ghosts of Pinebrook is a Fifth Edition adventure for four level one player characters and should take them to level three while introducing them to the town of Pinebrook and the eaves of the Darkwood Forest.

The players will solve the mystery of missing travelers and, hopefully, prevent the spirit of a black half-dragon lich from returning to physical form and terrorizing the citizens of Pinebrook and beyond!

boardgame.name: The Order of Specialization
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new Wazard sub-class for 5E that lets you focus your talents on the perfection of a spell. You are able to manipulate that spell in multiple ways and become a master of specialized casting.

boardgame.name: Unearthed Tips & Tricks: Monthly (Nov 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unearthed Tips and Tricks: Monthly is a magazine containing a collection of ideas and concepts from the Crit Academy podcast. A D&D talk show designed to provide guidance and inspiration to both players and DMs. With the exception of the monsters, many of the ideas and concepts are system agnostic and can benefit players and DMs in many other systems and settings.

What you get:

Character Concept: We offer character ideas that can help bring your character to life. Whether you need a full character idea or use them as inspiration to enhance your already great character.

Monsters: We can often find that some of our favorite monsters get a little predictable, or we want a little more variation in our selection. We provide new monsters that can keep your characters on their toes, as well as load them up with flavor and lore to be discovered by the loremaster in your group.

Encounters: Here we offer a collection of short scenarios that can be used as a jumping-off point for a full adventure, a one-shot, or dropped into an existing campaign. It's chock-full of unique ideas and scenarios that we hope will spark your creative side, ensuring your players have an experience they will never forget.

Magic Items: Here we share custom magical items that you can drop into your game. Drop them into a chest, or have an enemy wield them against your characters.

Game Master Tips: Being a GM is tough work. Sometimes we could use a little bit of help. Much like a bag of holding, this section is packed to the brim with tips we've learned over the years to help you deliver the best gaming experience possible.

Player Tip: Oftentimes, we as players can take for granted the massive amount of work that the GM puts into the game. In the end, we don’t spend much time thinking about what we can bring to the table. The golden rule every player knows is "Don't be a D*ck!" In this section, we give you tips on how you can avoid doing just that, as well as tips on leveling up your gameplay. Both roleplay, and mechanical.

Two One-Page Adventures: I'm a huge fan of short and sweet. Each issue contains two one-page adventures written by best-selling adventure writers. This ensures you get fun, unique, and engaging adventures to last you through the night.

Adventure Map: Inside you will find a custom map, rich with setting descriptions to spark your imagination. Each copy comes with a link for the digital high-quality map for your hands, or Virtual Table Top experience.

boardgame.name: Warlord: Martial Class
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Warlords are talented and knowledgeable battle leaders. While many commanders stand in the rear during battle, they stand on the front-line shouting commands and bolstering their allies while leading the fight with weapons in hand. Warlords know how to unite their squad to acquire victory.
As a front-line commander, you lead others to triumph, a direct effect of your record. The most common background of a warlord is that of a warchief looking to earn renown for themselves and their clan. You are not locked into this of course. Your warlord could be a devout knight officer on leave or retired from your militia assembly, a youthful noble enthusiastic to apply years of preparation to life outside the protective walls of your home, a scheming mercenary boss, or a brave marshal of the outlands who bouts to protect or ravage the frontier. Regardless of your background, you are a skillful warrior with a gift for masterful leadership.
Your constant training in heavy equipment reduces its weight and size to no more than a minor annoyance. Instead, it is as familiar as the arms of a lover. A worn weapon grip molds to your hand as if it were a natural extension of your arm. It’s time to go into battle - and to lead those who follow
This 5th Edition D&D resource is a complete player option for the Warlord Class. The PDF includes rules, lore, and tables for enhancing your character's story and background.

boardgame.name: Beyond The Veil
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Continue your journey on the new road to High Adventure

Behold! It is the chosen time for all Clerics to step forth on behalf of their Gods and lead the faithful to their ultimate destinies.

HARP Beyond the Veil breathes new life into the Cleric and Paladin professions, expanding the range of possibilities for GMs and players alike. GMs will be able to create believable religions for their worlds, shaping them across ten characteristics and drawing upon real-world examples. Players will benefit from more tailored characters, matching religious mode and deity domain to create well defined, three dimensional Clerics and Paladins.
Found within:

An analysis of religions in classics of fantasy literature
Exploration of religions in the real world
Guidance on creating and customising religions for your setting
More than 40 domains of powers for Gods and their Clerics
Twelve new variant Clerics professions (including the Animist, the Cardinal, the Extirpationist, the Liturgist, the Missionary, and the Oracle)
The Paladin (Holy Warrior) profession and its own Spell Sphere
Ten new training packages (including the Abbot, Guru, Sacrificer and Sellsword)

boardgame.name: Steel Dragon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Beware the Steel Dragon

Steel Dragon robots are some of the strongest and heaviest-hitting robotic soldiers on the criminal market today. As such, these designer constructs are used by a number of criminals and mob bosses who can afford such an expensive weapon to hold in their “back pocket.”

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes you a need a character everyone recognizes, even when meeting them for the first time.

boardgame.name: The Wreck of the Paitr Ihrdale
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An original level 3-4 short adventure made for D&D 5e.

A barge crashed on the rocks, and the heroes are hired to salvage whatever goods remain on the wreck. Unfortunately, the adventurers aren’t the only ones interested in the cargo.

boardgame.name: The Vitrified Village
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A fantastic alien ruin seemingly made of glass is the site of a fateful encounter on the planet Ashe. A local cult has taken over the ruins in order to worship the site’s enigmatic builders and to initiate their expected Grand Communion — the joining of the adherents and the idols of their worship. But when the PCs are hired by the ruins’ caretaker to investigate what the sect is actually doing, the heroes come face-to-face with the planet’s past and its destiny. Either might spell the abrupt end of their adventures.

The Vitrified Village is a short science fiction adventure using the Cepheus Engine, Cepheus Deluxe, and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game rules. Other 2D6 systems are easily adapted.

boardgame.name: Hazard: Limnic Eruption!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A fun day out on the lake boating, fishing, and swimming. Drinks on the shore with laughing friends, then retire to lakeside cabanas for a good night’s sleep. But they never wake up. During the night, the lake — the same lake that served as the backdrop for such a pleasant day — becomes a silent killer as it belches forth a deadly, invisible cloud that suffocates the revelers in their sleep.

A limnic eruption — also known as a lake overturn — is a sudden eruption of a large quantity of carbon dioxide (CO2) gas from the bottom of a lake or similar body of water. Limnic eruptions have killed thousands by asphyxiation. On our Earth, this has only happened twice in modern times, both in 1986, and both in the west African nation of Cameroon. But scientists are fearful it could happen again, at a much larger lake with a much larger resident population. The resulting disaster would result in the deaths of up to two million people.

Hazard: Limnic Eruption! explores this rare but deadly phenomenon and offers Cepheus Engine, Cepheus Deluxe, and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game Referees a chance to introduce it into hir game. This short file is packed with information on the cause of a limnic eruption, a brief history, their characteristics, and game stats.

Hazard: Limnic Eruption! Hold your breath.

boardgame.name: Artifacts of the Giant-folk
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #7 of Populated Hexes Monthly examines a glacial valley strewn with the leavings of the ancient giant-folk culture. Includes rules for incorporating giant-folk rune magic into your OSE or similar game.

boardgame.name: The Heart of the Beast
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dare you travel inside the body of this colossal creature?

A printable rpg battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl or skirmish game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset. The map is 50x50, equivalent to 25 of our standard 10x10 tiles.

Contents: A pair of 50x50 battlemaps depicting the blood vessels and heart of a giant creature or monster. Travel within the body of a giant, exploring the chambers of the heart, and venturing along veins and arteries.

Includes a living and rotten/decayed version

boardgame.name: The Quest Kids: Big Bads of Tolk's Cave
boardgame.description:
The Quest Kids are back in a new expansion for the acclaimed dungeon crawler for young players 5 years old and up!

The Quest Kids: Big Bads of Tolk's Cave introduces a new Quest Kid hero (Flint the Dragon), player specific dice, unique items, story-driven event cards, epic boss battles and more.

For 2-5 players ages 5 and up Big Bads of Tolk's Cave builds on the fantasy gaming foundation established by The Quest Kids by adding even more dungeon crawler essentials.

A Quest Kids quest is never done!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Truth or Drink: On the Turps (Aussie Edition)
boardgame.description:
A whole carton of refreshing Aussie truth! Over 300 ripper new questions, for those with a hard-earned thirst for knowledge.

Think you know your mates? Drink again. By the end of the night, we’ll all be better friends after sharing the things we never thought we’d say out loud. Heaps of crisp, fresh questions. Aussie as.

Every turn, a judge draws a question card and selects two people to either answer or drink. Players win the round by giving a satisfying answer and being awarded the question card.

boardgame.name: Wilderness Dressing: Ruins (2.0 - 5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of glossing over the details of your characters’ overland journey (except for the inevitable, violent random encounters)? Want to add in minor features of interest to their journeys? Want to make their journeys seem more “real”?

Then Wilderness Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different type of wilderness and gives you--the busy GM--the tools to bring such locales to life with interesting and cool noteworthy features, events and encounters. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, it is an invaluable addition to your GM's toolbox!

boardgame.name: Wilderness Dressing: Ruins (2.0 - OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of glossing over the details of your characters’ overland journey (except for the inevitable, violent random encounters)? Want to add in minor features of interest to their journeys? Want to make their journeys seem more “real”?

Then Wilderness Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different type of wilderness and gives you--the busy GM--the tools to bring such locales to life with interesting and cool noteworthy features, events and encounters. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, it is an invaluable addition to your GM's toolbox!

boardgame.name: Hello Kitty: The Worldwide Game
boardgame.description:
Hello Kitty and her Friends in an exciting and adventurous race around the world.
Take a card, move your piece and be the first to reach the Beatyfull Place. Collect fantasy cards and earn precious objects along the way.
Who will be first to end their journey?

boardgame.name: Goblin Raiding Camp (Remastered)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monstrous Lair #4: Goblin Raiding Camp provides you—the busy, time-crunched—with the details to effortlessly bring to life the goblin raiding camps in your campaign. Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your adventures, dungeons and campaign to life? This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your dungeons. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

boardgame.name: Magicon
boardgame.description:
A family card game which leads to story creation, supporting logical thinking and improving perceptual abilities.

You play saviors of the mysterious realm Magicon, which suffers the invasions of the dark forces. Your party travels to the outskirts of Magicon, but only one of you will succeed. Which one of you is the chosen one who will make the journey to the Wizardon? Who is the one who becomes the savior of the eternal light, entrusts them to the hands of the Great Mage and ignites the hope for the whole Magicon?

A strategy game for 2-6 players. The goal of each round of the game is to get rid of all the cards. You place your cards one by one so that the color markings expressing the journey through the land of Magicon. The score depends on the last card dealt. The more northern the region, the more points. It doesn't matter whether the player finished sooner or later.

The game is played on multiple rounds. Every time the game is finished, players mark their points on the scoring board with a playing figure of the chosen color. Whoever reach 10 points on the scoring boar, wins.

boardgame.name: Ballad of an Outlaw
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You recall the mission briefing, ten days ago. It seemed like a straightforward operation.

“The Valenko, a private cargo transport, was attacked and destroyed. Among its manifest was an important crate, property of Tri-Corp. Investigators of the wreckage traced a leaking plasma trail to a starship scrapyard some light years away. They were shot at by defense turrets and retreated. Coordinates of the scrapyard, our only lead, are on this navigation card. You and your crew must track down those responsible, deliver justice, and, most importantly, recover a cargo crate marked 44041. Any questions?”

Now you recall the words of a crazy prophet at the starport as you cower before the might of an impossible foe and wonder how it came to this?

This short assignment can be placed anywhere in the frontier, though a default suggested location is provided for those playing in the provided setting. Although it uses Tri-Corp as a framework, it can easily be adapted to any corporation or government that fits the GM’s setting.

And this short assignment contains… a song! I swear!

Contains:

1 page credits/contents
25 pages of content
12 pages of appendices showing player and GM maps, NPC stats, and adventure scaling suggestions
1-3 sessions of low-prep-time sci fi fun!

boardgame.name: 4 přírodovědné hry
boardgame.description:
A folder of four game plans with dice and figures. Games for young schoolchildren, which introduce children to the world of animals, evolution and European birds. When they play, there is room for creating their own stories.

The folder is laminated on 2 mm thick cardboard and has a size of 98 x 34 cm when fully unfolded. The package includes a bag with a wooden cube and 4 figures and a set of chips made of hard cardboard.

The Poaching Game is a cooperative game where a team plays against poachers who steal animals. The goal is to secure a given number of animals on all continents and free the stolen animals from poachers. Players travel the world and save an animal when they enter a field with the particular animal. However, there are also hordes of poachers on the route, over which you have to win in dice fights, otherwise the animal will go into captivity. The tension in the game can be increased by putting more animals in captivity at the beginning. The game plan with the animals is set in a real map, so non-violent learning about the continents and their animals is ensured.

The Bird Game is a contribution to refreshing our birds knowledge. Players travel in concentric circles to a nest. You overcome cats in battles and run away from a storm, hawk or ornithologist. To enter the next circle, the player must collect 4 tokens, which you get when entering the squares with birds.

In Evolution, players run freely around the game board and on evolutionary accelerators you gain and exchange different parts of the body in exchange offices. The goal is to collect the body parts for the animal you choose and bring it to its field. At the end of the game you have the honor to describe or draw a monster in which you would evolve using all the body parts you have collected.

Crazy Animals is a simple game in which children compose torn sentences about animals in Czech and English. This is how sentences like "I am a green giraffe singing in the fridge" are created.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: 4x for preschoolers and young schoolchildren

boardgame.name: Dragons and Owls and Bears, Oh My!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A local recluse has put out the most curious of jobs on the message board - monster hunters wanted to either kill or capture an escaped specimen out near the previously abandoned wizard's tower. What will your party discover in the tower, and what will the fate be of this escaped specimen?

Dragons and Owls and Bears, Oh My! is a Fifth Edition adventure designed for four to six characters of 6th to 10th level and is optimized for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 9.

This adventure contains 2 new creatures, 4 custom battlemaps, 3 new magic items and two musical tracks to bring your session to life!

boardgame.name: Sands of the Constant
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Yldram the Constant One's terrifying blue visage can be seen throughout the history of the Eastern Nations. It is by his mercy that the lands have thrived, but over the seasons, something has shifted. With his violence showing no end and fierce lighting storms tearing across the lands, something must be done. Can you take down the nigh-immortal dragon?

Sands of the Constant is a Fifth Edition adventure designed for four to six characters of 17th to 20th level and is optimized for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 20.

This adventure contains 5 new creatures, 2 custom battlemaps, 3 new magic items and two musical tracks to bring your session to life!

boardgame.name: Dead in the Water
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mayday! Mayday! Mayday! This is cargo freighter Tarcza, is anyone out there???

Your crew comes upon an abandoned ship in the middle of nowhere, begging some questions: why is it here, what happened on board, are the crew still alive, and, most importantly, is something more sinister at play? Find the answers to these questions and more in Dead in the Water for the Mothership Sci-Fi Horror RPG!

Crews can explore The Tarcza, a mysteriously empty cargo freighter, to discover just what is REALLY going on! DitW features:

-Two options for play: one clean and one messy, for exploring the final fate of those aboard.

-Detailed maps for both levels of the ship.

-Ship section breakdowns and notation for running both modes of play, for when you want to throw your crew a curveball and switch back and forth.

-A deadly horror with a singular agenda.

Dead in the Water is suitable for use as a one shot adventure, for dropping into an ongoing campaign, or for starting off a new campaign.

boardgame.name: Kingdom of Sorrows
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A party of adventurers gets more than they bargain for when they agree to rescue a kidnapped princess to avert a war between two kingdoms!

boardgame.name: We 5
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Genetically altered to possess psionic powers, five children are thrust into a top-secret base. To what end? That's what you will find out when you play "We 5", a sci-fi tale of mystery and adventure!

boardgame.name: Animarium Codex
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magical artifacts are a staple of fantasy worlds. They can empower heroes to perform the impossible or turn the tide against them in the hands of their enemies. An arcane tome could teach dark rituals or words of primordial power, driving a character towards an unexpected path. A divine sword can be the cause of an apocalyptic event or inspire the birth of a new nation.

This supplement is dedicated to magic items and their creation. The first chapter explores the manufacturing process of animariums, magic items powered by spirits. It features a society on the verge of an industrial revolution based on these arcane devices. The second chapter lists 24 new magic items that fit any 5E setting. From the common, everyday objects that embellish fictional storytelling to legendary artifacts that can shape the course of history, this codex has a little something for every adventure.

Lastly, the supplement contains a new playable race - the reclaimed. Part mortal and part spirit, reclaimed are torn between two worlds. Driven to emotional extremes by their spirit, reclaimed are considered eccentric at best and insane at worst. Many of them find it difficult to blend in society, so they choose to travel alone or band with other misfits as adventurers.

boardgame.name: The Angels & Devils Trilogy
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Angels & Devils Trilogy is a series of adventures for the world's greatest roleplaying game (5e).

The dwarven stronghold Cragtop Citadel has fallen prey to a devil incursion. The people of the Vermilion Highlands are unaware and unprepared. You must unravel the citadel's mysteries and escape with your life. Explore the highlands and light the celestial beacons. Can you claim the legendary sword Devil's Bane from a fallen angel? Before all is over, you must face the general of the infernal armies: the pit fiend Baaldemor. The fate of the highlands rests on you!

This 140-page book contains the adventures:

- The Secret of Cragtop Citadel
- Devil's Bane
- Wrath of the Pit Fiend
plus the Heaven & Hell Codex with new game material.

The book features:

- player handouts, including an adventurers' map of the region in "explorers' style" (in both a DM and a player version) by cartographer Thomas Rey
- stunning monster, character and other images by commissioned professional illustrators such as Verena Biskup (The Dark Eye RPG), Iromonik, and Daniel Kang
- print and VTT versions of all site and battle maps, rendered in great detail by Venatus Maps and RustyMaps
- detailed NPCs with illustrations and full descriptions of their agendas and how to roleplay them
- new monsters, including new types of angels (celestial agents, fallen angels), new types of devils (cutter devils, slithering devils), hellfire lions that can drag their prey with them to Hell, spellblooded pixies, and more
- new celestial and infernal magic items, including the angel blade Devil's Bane, ligthning bolas, hellfire braziers, and more
- Legend & Lore revealing secrets about The Infinite War between the angels and devils, as well as the forbidden Dark Roads under the mountains
- Angelic blessings and boons, diabolical cultists and their infernal powers, dwarven treasure and name tables, and more

The trilogy is designed for a party of levels 6-8 and the DM can adapt the difficulty level. The trilogy can be played as a sequel to the adventure To Catch A Unicorn, but this isn't required

boardgame.name: To Catch A Unicorn
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Epic 5E adventure module in an enchanted forest!

Suitable for 4-6 characters of level 4-5, this 110-page adventure includes:

+ The main campaign, engaging the party in the epic fight between an evil witch and the Forest Lord unicorn. The party must explore and survive the magic woods of Zinamistra, and succeed in calling the unicorn. The adventure includes an extensive forest map, many adventure sites, planned and random encounters, and new game mechanics for enchanted forests and for calling the unicorn.

+ Beautiful maps by Venatus Maps, also provided as electronic files for VTT

+ Illustrations by talented artists including commissions by Verena Biskup and the cover by Alexey Rostunov

+ Three appendices filled with 13 new monsters & Non-Player Characters, 19 new spells & magic items, and new rules for herbs and plants, with a compilation of 12 special herbs for use in this adventure and beyond.

boardgame.name: To Catch A Unicorn Special Edition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Epic 5E adventure module in an enchanted forest!

The Special Edition of To Catch A Unicorn is 120 pages long and comes with a cool alternative cover. It features two additional "secret chapters" full of material to take this epic adventure to the next level.

Suitable for 4-6 characters of level 4-5, this 110-page adventure includes:

+ The main campaign, engaging the party in the epic fight between an evil witch and the Forest Lord unicorn. The party must explore and survive the magic woods of Zinamistra, and succeed in calling the unicorn. The adventure includes an extensive forest map, many adventure sites, planned and random encounters, and new game mechanics for enchanted forests and for calling the unicorn.

+ Beautiful maps by Venatus Maps, also provided as electronic files for VTT

+ Illustrations by talented artists including commissions by Verena Biskup and the cover by Alexey Rostunov

+ Three appendices filled with 13 new monsters & Non-Player Characters, 19 new spells & magic items, and new rules for herbs and plants, with a compilation of 12 special herbs for use in this adventure and beyond.

boardgame.name: The Dead Mines
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Evil Waits In the Darkness

The smoke rises from the abandoned mine again. A group of orcs started digging, trying to get inside the ruins, driven by the power that is beyond their understanding. A young scholar is looking for a long-lost truth. And deep down, an ancient evil is lurking, waiting for a fool to release it once more…

The Dead Mines is a two-session adventure for a party of 5th level characters designed for the 5th and 3.5 edition of the world's most popular role-playing game. Featuring a closed story that is designed so you can drop into any campaign or play it standalone, new monsters and items, this adventure is sure to put your players on their toes. Will you be brave enough to prevent the return of a Demon Lord?

Content
An epic 4 part story, worth 2-3 sessions of gameplay
5 new maps
6 new monsters, with token art!
2 new magic items
